Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chox25
Reviews.Content: Too far to the main sites. The room key was too heavy to carry around. Breakfast is not included. It has a balcony but not much to see outside. The front desk staff and the cleaning crew are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: no_comments
Reviews.Content: Loud at night, sheets not changed for full week's stay. 15 minute walk to nearest metro.Certainly not worth the positive reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole F
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels stays that I have ever had, foreign or domestic. Totally rude staff (to tourists, but seemingly not so to business travelers). Zero help with regard to attractions, directions, money exchange, and the like..... Room had no natural light, and no possibility of changing rooms. ZERO amenities... No coffee, etc. This hotel nearly ruined a great trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Coquet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SIordache
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice, the rooms are small ( is the normal size room for Barcelona Hotels) and very elegant. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. We book the Hotel on-line and the price was great, and we receive the best service/value for our money. It may be the located in downtown but we love long walks and that part of the Barcelona. It is close to public transportation and using the subway you can reach any part of the city. Great - Hotel ! ( Free Wi-fi in the loby area and good breakfast to )

Reviews.Title: “Connecting Family Room Available”
Reviews.Author: Gary_GFleetHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Easter holiday as a family of 4. Hotel gave us two connecting rooms. Very clean, plenty of space in each room and overall a nice hotel. Was a 30min walk to the top of Las Ramblas and uphill on the way back....but kept everyone fit!

Reviews.Title: “Get a room at the back if you do not enjoy clubs and loud music”
Reviews.Author: daisyleaf
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel with helpful staff and good facilities, but over the road is a disco/club which goes on until 6am Thursday - Saturday with very loud music and people spilling out over the pavement for most of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: donperico
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend of mine during two nights because we had a congress in Barcelona the next day. The room altough a little bit small were clean as well as the bathroom. Breakfast was OK and the location of the hotel was the best for us, very near from Diagonal street and to another interesting places in the city which we had the opportunity to visit. I would return here without doubt because it is value for the money and the location

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from the attractions, easy access.”
Reviews.Author: DpwSrq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a cruise. Easy to find but not close to the tourist areas. Although, it is an easy ride on the bus (we like being like the locals) to Placa Catalunya. Otherwise, it is a 15 to 20 min walk. Very nice room with lots of closet space and room to store bags. Modern decor. Our room had the sink in the bedroom and the toilet/shower behind a glass door (does not completely seal) - so note this if you have privacy issues with whomever you are sharing the room with. Nice double glazed windows but I still heard the disco boom-boom of a young people bar across the street - only happened one night. Two elevators of the tiny european size. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: Laps848
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here to end a vacation. Very comfortable room and large bathroom/shower. Perfectly acceptable Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: anna_apo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condado Hotel for 3 nights. Have booked through booking.com, after reading the positive comments from tripadvisor...Good value for money. The hotel is located in a quiet area. We will definitely choose again this hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: panda111271
Reviews.Content: We spent here three nights at the beginning of december. Our room was a little bit cold and not so cozy, maybe because of the dark colours of furniture. The breakfast was good. About the position: a bit far from the city centre...on Sunday I waited long time the bus, but at the end I preferred to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: Marina M
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Reasonable price, cozy rooms, good service, nice breakfast. Is located not far from Diagonal metro station and bus stops, but we went on foot to most Barcelona sights. It took about half an hour to get to Ramblas and Catalonia Square. But I like walking so it was ok. Will definitely choose this hotel for my next staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible City”
Reviews.Author: HeHateMe08
Reviews.Content: From the beach, to Gaudi, to Las Ramblas, to wherever, this city is SICK!!! Condado was nicely located around loads of bars, clubs and restaurants. Our rooms has a decent-sized balcony overlooking many residential high-rises...a little below us some guy let it ALL HANG OUT!!! haha - anyway, you can't go wrong with this place. Rooms, closet, and bathroom all good size. Most sights are walkable, too. Do people ever sleep in that town!?!?!?!?!??! Walking home at 6am and there was STILL a line outside a club across the streeet from the hotel. You only live once so live it up, people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Elvin J
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. You really get value for money. The location is just great, short walk to the nice street Passeig de Gràcia which leads you all the way to the city centre. The area offers some great restaurants where you can meet the locals and avoid all the tourists.. You can also find some nice stores and a shopping centre few hundred meters up the street. A hot night club Sutton Club is just around the corner, so is Luz de Gaz for the older crowd. As for the hotel room, it is nice clean and simple. The personnel are friendly. Probably a good choice for younger couples and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality at an excellent price !”
Reviews.Author: pierre.lima
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Condado, recently renovated with a simple but nice and modern décor, is an excellent choice for those seeking not only a good price/quality hotel, as well as a relatively central location in Barcelona (about 30 minutes walk to Plaça de Catalunya town center). The hotel also has a very nice particularity for families accomodation. At least between first and the sixth floor, it has 3 sets of two rooms separated by a private and closed camera, like a mini suite, at no extra charge. Our rooms were numbers 502 and 503. Another quite enjoyable peculiarity are the minibars existing in each room floor corridors always filled with free of charge fresh water bottles. Breakfast, served in a quite large room of the ground floor, is of good quality, better than many four-star hotels. All the staff were attentive and friendly and the room's cleaning was very good. In the cosy and confortable entrance lobby there are two computers with free internet access as well as a fast and also free wireless access. In front of the hotel you have a convenient Mercadona supermarket and, nearby, good restaurants of spanish and/or international food, as for example the well-known restaurant Moncho's Barcelona or the Casa Paloma.

Reviews.Title: “Once again...”
Reviews.Author: HeskimoUK
Reviews.Content: Well looked after and very comfortable. For the price, it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly out of the buzz of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: cruachan
Reviews.Content: But also fairly convenient to the Metro. Great place to start wandering from, with some good cafe/restaurants close by. Good accommodation, friendly staff, did not try the restaurant, clean room, nice bath. Supermarket located across the road. Room at the rear with balcony, view not inspiring but on a sunny day, perfect for some sun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful return to the Hotel Condado...”
Reviews.Author: lindabail
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel in the Gracia section of Barcelona as we had stayed there over New Years prior to a cruise to the Eastern Med. We were getting ready to take a Canary Island cruise and decided to stay again at the Condado, as we felt it was a respit away from the tourist areas. We were greeted by name as we checked in about noon in late October. We were upgraded to a superior room with a balcony overlooking the avenue. The weather was beautiful as we sat on the balcony sipping a glass of wine. There is a market across the street that has everything you need for your stay. The local wines are a treat and they have fresh fruit , wines and cheeses. The breakfast was very good although the gentleman serving the buffet looked overwhelmed. The coffee was in a precarious position, on a shelf over the food preperation. I would find a seperate station for the coffee and cream as people could not get to it as others were serving themself from the buffet. Otherwise, the room was so clean and quiet. The housekeeping staff and I had fun trying to understand each other as I asked for more wash clothes. They were always very helpful. The Condado is a find in Barcelona. We were not very far from the large department store, Ingles which has a great market also. The hotel is in a residential area with homes and embassys. The people are friendly and helpful. There is a bus across the street and we even found our way to the Sagrada Familia and toured the inside. Don't miss this!

Reviews.Title: “Free water bottles, free use of internet and pc!”
Reviews.Author: MY30
Reviews.Content: For once I will try to write a short review - so people would actually bother to read it! + Strengths: Free water bottles Nice and helpful staff Good breakfast Nice and clean room - flat screen TV - nice interior - modern. Our bedroom was on the first floor, facing the street, but we could barely hear the cars outside Around the reception area there were two PCs that the guests can use, with free internet! That was awesome! Easy to get to and from the airport-hotel. Bus 58 stops just around the corner of the hotel and takes you to Placa Catalanya where the main shopping streets are! - Weaknesses: Glas door into the bathroom... I just generally don’t like to pee or poop when others can see and hear me! And the sink was in the bedroom, and not in the bathroom! Other than that, the bathroom was nice. You might not hear the noise from the street, but you could hear people talking in the hallway. Bad sound isolation from the hallway into the bedroom. Me and my friend were actually woken up by people walking through the hallway talking one morning. The metro station is 15 minutes walk from the hotel... If you don’t like to walk, you can take bus 58 to Placa Catalanya, and from there you can take the metro to anywhere you like! A bit far from the city center, but it didn’t bother us as it was easy access to buses and the metro. OK - this wasn’t a short review after all - but hey, I just want to let people know what they can expect! I would highly recommed this hotel! I don’t understand why it is only a 3 star hotel... I would definitly stay here again next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, but could do better?”
Reviews.Author: Lucy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family for 2 nights during half-term. The hotel is superbly located and comfortable and clean - good value for money. HOWEVER, breakfast was unimpressive and there really needs to be an enhanced kitchen facility - to be unable to sit down and have a drink when you come back in from sightseeing in the late afternoon is an annoyance. The hotel staff was courteous, but less friendly than they could have been. Almost any other inhabitant of Barcelona you come across has a more ready smile! Not sure why.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ajdin
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for 3nights with 6friends. Free WIFI ( if your room was on a low floor...or free cabel-internett ). The location of the hotel was ok..few min by taxi to pretty much everywere you wanna go. The staff were curteous enough. The standard of the hotel was pretty good, with nice and comfy bed. Well equiped. I have just one negative thing to say about the hotel, which irritaded me quite a lot...they have only one key per room which is used to oped the door of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Above average and nice price”
Reviews.Author: cash1981
Reviews.Content: Free wifi and bottle water, but not all floors gets wifi. Overall good for the price paid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in its price range”
Reviews.Author: GC_Glasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and were very pleased with the hotel. Rooms: Clean, well equipped, spacious. Our room was infacing to the central light shaft rather than the street. (a lot of buildings in Barcelona have an open bit in the middle to allow natural light in) we were on the first floor so not loads of natural light and no view but very peaceful-no noise at all and we we weren't really in during the day so not bothered by the minimal daylight. Free bottled water was great. A nice sitting area in lobby with free wifi and two computers with free internet and a printer. Staff were poltie and helpful-booked us tickets for the football and had them delivered to the hotel at no extra cost, printed out bus time tables for us etc. We did not have breakfast in the hotel so cannot comment. Location- a good area, felt quite safe. A supermarket across the road was handy and plenty of cafes etc for breakfast. Also some restuarants round the corner, we ate there first night and was nice, all local residents there, not tourists. The hotel is about 10mins walk to Ramblas La Catalunya, which itself becomes La Ramblas further down. La Catalunya has a lot of lovely places to eat outside with better value and food than further down on La Ramblas. The metro is about 10mins walk, cheap and easy to use, I would recommend it to get about. We did the hop on/off tour bus which was fine but should have used the metro more. We did walk to La Sagrada Familia also from the hotel but can easily get the bus or metro. Barcelona is a lovely city with so much to see. I would recommend this hotel as a great base.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean room”
Reviews.Author: roughway
Reviews.Content: Great staff and lovely clean (if a little soul-less) room Very helpful staff, suggested bus trip, restaurant and organised cab to airport but not at all pushy. Polite and helpful Nice part of Barcelona Room was quiet with juliet balcony Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Junet850
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and were very happy. Our room was spotlessly clean and well maintained. The breakfast was excellent - a buffet with good choices. The Staff could not have been more helpful and we definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve43111
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Courteous and friendly service, immaculate bedroom and very nice breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: RobertBlackwood
Reviews.Content: This us a great hotel as a base fir exploring Barcelona. Very clean and spacious rooms, helpful staff and very peaceful despite being in a central location. Free wifi and water were nice additional touches.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Droid0162
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located - about 10 minute walk to Diagonal metro and the metro works really, really well. Buy a tarjeta for 10 journeys from the machine at the metro (about 8 euros) - it's excellent value for money. This is a lovely boutique hotel with spotlessly clean rooms and a good breakfast to set you up for the day, with a selection of pastries, toast and jam or eggs, bacon and sausages. There is no evening meal available here but this is Barcelona and you don't have to go far to eat!! If you come out of the hotel and turn left and go just around the corner you will find a nice bar. The rooms are fairly spacious and nicely decorated in a modern style with lots of hanging space in the wardrobe. The bathroom is also modern style and is big with it's own separate toilet cubicle and a very large shower cubicle. The hotel provide free bottles of water in mini fridges on the landing on each floor. Our room faced a small club on the other side of the road and we were a bit sceptical this might be noisy but the windows were quadruple glazed and we were not disturbed at all - we slept very well and typically in Spain the youngsters know how to behave and there is no drunken disorderly behaviour here. In fact it was really nice on the Saturday when we were on our way back from our sightseeing in the city to see all the under 18's queuing to get into an "afternoon" disco - there was so much excitement from them, it was a real event and the staff at the hotel explained that they just go to dance, there is no alcohol allowed. I want to mention the club to be honest in my review but I can also honestly say it is not a problem at all and I am really fussy! There is so much to see in Barcelona, it really has everything, the port, the beach, the old town, brilliant shopping, Gaudi, Picasso, wonderful food and the best atmosphere. You can walk around Barcelona and even travel on the metro late into the night and feel perfectly safe - lots of people about. The advice (sensibly) is to keep a close eye on your belongings when out and about as there will always be opportunist pickpockets in crowded areas but you just need to be aware and sensible. The staff at reception were very hospitable and went out of their way to help us. I would most definitely stay at the Condado again when I come back to visit this beautiful city and I can hardly wait until I do!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Chasey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October 2011 Had an excellent, clean, big room. Staff were friendly, rooms were very quiet. Once the cleaners forgot the towels but within minutes the staff were at the door with more. The location is good. 5 minute walk from the Rambla Catalunya (infinitely nicer than la Ramblas) and Passage de Gracia (and the tube station 'diagonal') No complaints. Excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbxturbo
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very helpful and accomodating. They knew all of the bus route numbers to help you get anywhere. They knew of nice restaurants close by. Very reasonable rates. We would stay there again! and again!! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: suzanne-john
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Condado Hotel 3 times now...and we will return again when in Barcelona. Easy access with bus from airport.( Aerobus to Catalunya and bus 58 to hotel ) 10 minute walk to Ramblas along ave Diagonal.. Plenty of restaurants and shops nearby including a supermarket in front. Rooms are very clean and soundproof. Buffet breakfast is great and makes a good start to the day. The staff are very helpful and professional and speak a variety of languages. Great service all round in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Gràcia Disrict”
Reviews.Author: 8a8yd011
Reviews.Content: I want to start out by saying that the staff here is very very helpful and courteous. We had a hard time trying to use our key to open our room door. The man from the front desk went out of his way to help us out without hesitating. They also helped us with directions and calling a cab for us whenever we needed one. Don't worry if you think your Spanish isn't that great. They speak English really well. Our room was small, but comfortable. We had a room with a view of the heating unit in the center of the building. But this didn't bother us since we spent most of our time exploring Barcelona. The room was very clean and modern. The only small complaint that I had was the WiFi and the location. The WiFi signal was very weak from the floor that we stayed on. So, I had to frequent the computers in the hotel lobby. The location is great if you are in Barcelona for business since this is located in a Business and Fashion district. If you are not, it is a little inconvenient to move around the city. During our stay the FRG stop close to Condado was under construction so the next closest line was the Passeig de Gràcia station which was about a 15-20 minute walk. The closest attractions to this hotel are Casa Batlló and Casa Milà which is close to the Gràcia station. Sagrada Familia and Park Guell are still about 25-30 minute walks. To sum, the location might not be ideal for some, but this is very nice hotel in the Gràcia district. Great staff, very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms without sunlight”
Reviews.Author: RAMAZAN Y
Reviews.Content: I lived in the neighbourhood for almost two years, the street (Aribau) is extremely active at night. Here we have the dilemma: Rooms with street view is affected by loud people at night, the other rooms are not affected, however, there's not a single sunlight entrance into other rooms of the hotel.. No sunlight at all..

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: NYADDICT
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a very nice and non touristy neighborhood. Around 15 minutes walk to Las Ramblas but very nice walk on the very nice Diagonal Avenue. Room nicely decorated, simple but very comfortable and modern. Very clean. For sure if I come back to Barcelona Condado Hotel will be my choice! We had it at a very good price 68E per night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Roscoe11
Reviews.Content: Two nights here as part of lads Golf Trip. Perfect for what we wanted i.e. 3 star, very clean, small room but ample for two lads sharing with two sets of golf clubs! Bathroom was good, no views but who cares when you come in at 4.00 a.m. and go out for Golf at 10.00 a.m.! Staff were fine, the usual non gushing Continentals but that is not a criticism. Overall very happy with Hotel for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “very nice mgrclean roomclean bathrooma little bit noise on the street but thx to tight air glass windowno big proovera”
Reviews.Author: andylu0822
Reviews.Content: very nice mgr clean room clean bathroom a little bit noise on the street but thx to tight air glass window no big pro overall i will come back again when come to bcn

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: terryEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Overall, an extremely good hotel and excellent value for money. The reception area is attractive and clean and bright although rather small. There is free internet and a fridge with free water. My family had breakfast and said it was superb. The room was very stylish and modern although a tad on the small side if you are looking to be critical. Also, it had no view, just in case that is a key requirement for you. One of these rather unusual continental toilets with a glass door that didn't really lock and which had spaces around the frame .. perhaps not the place to go with a new partner! Staff all very friendly. Location wise, it was off one of the main streets in the city, albeit one that runs for about 4 miles. It is not slap bang in the centre but not as far as some people would have you believe. There is a bus stop close by and metro not much further. Finally, no point commenting on Barcelona other than to say; believe the hype. One of the best cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lap155004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated to visit the city center. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet at a very reasonable price. The hotel is close to the city touring bus departure. During our trip to Spain and Portugal, it was the only hotel that provided free internet access to its clients. It would be wise to ask for a room not facing the street, as there was noise all night coming from people across the street in front of a night club.(Friday and Saturday)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DorisB
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location is good, very near to Diagonal so an ideal base to get all around Barca. Our room was very nice, comfy beds, quiet air conditioning, a big balcony and a huge shower. The staff were very efficient and friendly and one who remembered which room was yours without asking. I would happily recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, very good location, very good deal”
Reviews.Author: injenswetrust
Reviews.Content: Only downsides are that it is about 4 blocks to closest metro and no wifi in rooms (only lobby); everything else is perfect: clean, recently renovated, complimentary wifi in lobby, large rooms, good bathrooms, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to lay your head, great location as well”
Reviews.Author: MartynCoup
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews from TripAdvisor. We were really impressed when we arrived, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Explained they needed our passports for five minutes (which is normal in Europe anyway). We checked into the room, took advantage of a couple of bottles of free water from the mini bar on the floor. Our room was very spacious with plenty of space for clothes and belongings. The location of the hotel is perfect. From the airport you can take the Aerobus to Placa de Cataluyna then take the L3 a couple of stops to Diagonal on the Metro. Then head towards the Deutsche Bank building and head down Av. Diagonal until Ariabu. Takes about 15/20 minute walk. The hotel were more than happy to book us a taxi for the return journey but you see so much more of the city using the public transport which is 1st class. We did not book breakfast so I am unable to comment but the facilities looked very good and clean like the rest of the hotel. I cannot recommend this location enough, it's in a perfect place for so many things such as the tour buses and public transport. I would consider this hotel again for my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: jennikup
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite stylish and citylike. Not fancy but almost! Our room was comfortable, elegant and clean - can you ask for more? The breakfast was ok, better than you usually get in Spain. There were different kinds of breads, cereal, muffins, fruit, little sausages, nice cheeses and jamons etc. There were only two things wrong with this hotel. The location and the staff. You could find restaurants (some of them very good) and a few cafes in the neighbourhood but for some reason there were nobody there: the streets were almost empty, restaurants closed when spanish people just started to eat. The life was near La Rambla and it was miles away. All the sights were far away too. And then the staff... We have never seen so indifferent, unpleasant and almost uptight hotel staff. Didn´t even say welcome when we arrived and never even looked at us when we returned to our room although we tried to smile and say hello.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place to hang your hat”
Reviews.Author: Myles539
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, very close to everything, there is no coffee maker in the room the room is quite small we faced the street and heard no noise due to the double windows that were installed less than 4 years ago. the internet works great its hardwired in the room and wifi downstairs in the lobby free of charge as a hotel guests. we didn't try the breakfast due to the price $21 euros a little pricey when you due the conversion from Canadian dollars but there many restaurants just out your door. there is a Starbucks close by also about 2 minute walk. there is a Grocery store right across the street, you can buy a bottle of wine for 99 cents about $dollar fifty six Canadian.a bottle of polish vodka for $ three dollars the wine was quite good too! the most expensive I saw on the Shelf was $3.50 for a Merlot. we really liked the staff they were quite helpful if we need anything whatsoever The major bus line is only a block away #58 will take you right downtown in about 10 minutes. its costs $1.30 euro. A word of warning !! make sure you check with the front desk about taxi fares. we took a taxi from the airport to the Condado the price was 35 euros with heavy traffic. when we were leaving I asked the hotel manger how much to the airport he told me about about 25-30 euro there was no traffic of any kind! and was charged $46 euro, I questioned the cabby on this he tried to tell me that he has to pay a tariff fee coming into the airport... we tried to ask someone at the airport about a tariff they knew nothing about such a thing.. He got no tip! David and Stacey

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMacFinn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week (well, almost) in Barcelona. We stayed in this Hotel Condado. The room was smallish but very nice, the beds comfortable and the room was very clean. Of course air conditioning worked. No noise from the next rooms. And there was free bottled water in the corridor. The personnel was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was perhaps a bit basic but the quality was good. The location is good, the bus connections work. Overall it's difficult to think why not to like this hotel. If you're looking for an affordable hotel in Barcelona, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Brazil1703
Reviews.Content: I don’t know exactly why I felt a little strange in this hotel. Maybe because it is not a chain hotel so was quite different from what I’m used to see. The hotel was good, fair size room, quite, clean bathroom, safe and cable high speed internet in the room, air conditioning and flat screen TV. I just missed the minibar. They offer two minibars per floor to share among the customers. Parking in the streets near by might be a problem. There are a couple private parkings close but you will need to pay around 18 Euros (~25 USD) per night. The closest metro station is around four blocks far. Not bad, not remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Would return despite small issues adding up”
Reviews.Author: 1984ian
Reviews.Content: Firstly the Pro's: - Location - Perfect location, hardly required to use public transport over our stay - Noise - Despite busy road, rooms are perfectly well soundproofed - Price - Reasonable rates although breakfast overpriced And the not- so-Pro's: - No kettle (unforgiveable!) and don't allow you to bring food or drinks into your room. - Although the room was always immaculately cleaned, the bedding was not changed over the week. - Hotel would benefit from more communal areas and bars to create more of an atmosphere. - Bed consisted of two singles pushed together rather than one double.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets”
Reviews.Author: ecniv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, and the staff was very helpful. My room was upgraded to a suite on the 8th floor - nice surprise. English was occasionally not understood, but then, we're not in England! I felt safe walking in the neighborhood. The market accross the street was a big plus, and there was a great cafe around the corner for morning coffee. [It was about 30 Euro taxi ride from the airport.] Yes, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Good Nightly Rate”
Reviews.Author: blairdover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Condado for a couple of nights pre-cruise. We loved the location - far away from tourist area so as not to be concerned with picpockets and noise. There were many "local" spots for dining and the hotel staff was great at giving dining suggestions. Only about a 10 minute walk to the Diagonal which was convenient to public transporation and the hop on/hop off tour bus - took it one day and it was a wonderful way to see the city! The hotel appears to be recently updated, very nicely decorated, very clean with helpful staff. Would certainly recommend and will stay there again if every in Barcelona. The only negative I have is that the mattress was very hard, but I slept well each night so obviously wasn't a bother!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: KerryP164
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an oasis - modern, beautifully clean and with comfortable bedroom and bathroom. The reception staff were always attentive, extremely helpful and went the extra mile to help me sort out printing problems. They also recommended great eating places and made us reservations (without us asking!). The only drawback was not having a fridge in our room. We loved Barcelona and this hotel was perfectly positioned for us - 30 mins walk to the city centre, located in the business district. Not great if you want to stay in the middle of things but good for a quiet room within easy reach of fabulous sights. If you drive into Barcelona, beware the one way streets!! It's a nightmare!! Kerry P

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely stay there again !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Condado, Barcelona in July 2011 . We loved it !!! the location was great- close enough to all attractions and far enough from all the night partying at Las Ramblas. The hotel was renovated and is deisgned in a modern fashion, and very very clean. The staff was very attentive and helpful.One day we took a taxi to a tapas restaurant and the driver charged us 13.50 euros. On the way back we paid 8.50 euros for the exact same distance, the front desk called the taxi station and they refunded us 5 euros which we tipped to the front desk clerks. In all, we highly recommend it and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great value, good location if you don't mind walking”
Reviews.Author: rudedogatx
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 6 night stay at Hotel Condado. It is a great value. The room was nice, they offered complimentary bottles of water, and free internet, as well as free wifi in the lobby. I thought the location was good. The street (Aribau) actually has a lot of bars/clubs so if you are into that thing you can walk to a lot of bars/clubs. Because its not in the main tourist area these bars and clubs will be filled with locals and not a bunch of tourists. This also means that they will only really be active Thurs-Sat night. We liked that, so it was perfect for us. Just remember that Pub 240 is not really a pub.... A couple of downsides: You are kind of far from the metro (Diagonal)...its like a 10-15 minute walk. But if you don't mind walking (and walking around Barcelona is easy) then its not a problem. It was hot in our room and the only way to turn the AC on is to use the room key. This fine when you are in the room, but when you leave the room the AC is off. I understand the reason for this is to conserve energy but it takes a while to cool down after coming back to a hot room. Not a big deal, but after a long day of walking the last thing you want to do is come back to a hot room. This is probably not a problem most of the year. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking I would never regret. Will stay again there for sure.”
Reviews.Author: SHOPnDINE
Reviews.Content: The first last minute booking I would never regret. Clean room and very easy access to hotel by bus (across the street). There is a Starbucks around the corner and many yummy restaurants and cafes just down the street. There is a grocery store right across the street but the shared fridge is located outside the room so we had to ask the front desk to store our perishables in the kitchen fridge. Worth to note that Wifi only available in the lobby, but you can get cable internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend the stay, great people, great sleep.”
Reviews.Author: LucieH11
Reviews.Content: - there were many buses in the hotel area, we didn´t have to use metro - Starbucks just around the corrner - grocery shops across the street - receptionist willing to help us - the room was cleaned every day - double window, we didn´t hear anything from the street - delicious breakfest - I recommend staying in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yo_spuddie121
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Condada for 5 nights on a city break after the reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel itself is very modern, very clean and in a quiet location and given the road layout in Barcelona very easy to find. The location is about 10-15 min walk to the metro or about 20/25 min walk to Placa de Catalunya – as one other reviewer put it - definitely a do-able stroll, but out of the way enough to deter you from returning to the hotel in the middle of the day to rest. We had a standard room which very clean, comfortable and quiet with an excellent bathroom/shower. No Wifi in the room although internet access is available (with good speed) via the Ethernet cable on the table or two pc’s in the lobby which have a printer. There are no refrigerators (there are some at reception for guest use but we did not use them) or tea making facilities in the room but free bottled water is available in the mini bar on each floor. The local supermarket directly over the road sells almost everything you need and there are numerous local cafes for breakfast (pastries and coffee) within a few minutes’ walk if you do not have this in your booking. Likewise there are numerous restaurants/bars within walking distance for dinner. Very helpful and friendly staff at the front desk who spoke good/excellent English to help with directions, which bus to catch, ordering taxis for the next morning etc Definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, quite a walk to nearest metro”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine. Clean and easy to find. Staff average - not especially friendly or helpful but not rude either. Use of internet and free bottled water were great. Wireless internet only available in the lobby. The room was especially small - probably one of the smaller ones I have ever had in a hotel. The bed seemed quite small too. We're not tall and both of us seemed to have our feet over the edge when we lay on the bed. About a 10 minute walk from the nearest metro - Diagonal. There is a supermarket across the road which is useful for snacks and drinks. There are also a number of bars nearby. There is a bakery across the road which worked well for breakfast. Price we paid was good, but the location isn't great in terms of easy access. Felt very safe and not at all threatened when walking back late at night. Primarily residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we'll sure be back.”
Reviews.Author: Andrei D
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a not noisy area. Taxi fare to La rambla ~ 7 eur. Friendly Staff - Gracias Ignacio!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: revimon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The first night we got a nice room but with a window that opened into the drainpipe. We asked to change the room and the hotel Replaced our room the next day to a 7th floor room with a sun terrace and a wonderful view. Through the hotel website we got a really good price. The room was Spacious and luxurious and the hotel even offers guests small water bottles from the mini bar for free. They even helped us locate lost luggage and called the flight company for us. The hotel area is more authentic and local.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, well located hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CallumLondon
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with what most other reviewers have said about the Condado Hotel. It's well located, on Avenue Diagonal in an upmarket area of the city, but only a 15 minute walk to the tourist area of Los Ramblas. A taxi from the airport cost €26. The front desk staff were polite and helpful, and were able to provide good restaurant recommendations and other information. There's no fridge in the room, so I asked for an ice bucket to keep my drinks cold and they were happy to oblige. The rooms have a tile floor, with simple, moden furnishings and an LCD TV. There weren't any English language channels available on TV, apart from CNN and BBC World. If you need to buy food, thee is a Mercadona supermarket directly opposite the hotel, but I found a better supermarket (called Caprabo) to be located a short walk away on Travessera de Gracia. On the downside, there isn't any in room wifi (only a network cable connection), and I found the airconditioning in one of the rooms of our group to be very weak. It was still effective enough to keep the room cool in the Barcelona summer though. One of the rooms had the washbasin in the room, with the toilet and shower in a separate area with only a glass door separating them. I didn't mind, but be sure to ask for a room in a separate bathroom if that's something you prefer. Overall, I'd definately recommend the Condado if you're on a short break to Barcelona and want to be close to, but not right in the middle of, the tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & surprisingly well located!”
Reviews.Author: CaFriends
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights post-cruise. Our friends from Barcelona were concerned that we would be disappointed, since the hotel was located a little farther away from the main sights, plus we had read some reviews that said that it was a 15 min. walk to the main metro, but PLEASE don't let this put you off. This hotel is a real gem!!! All the staff were extremely helpful & friendly. The day manager (sorry, I don't remember his name..) spoke impeccable English. When we arrived "way" early for our reservation (11 am), he immediately accommodated us with a "resting room". The room was lovely, yet he offered to upgrade us to a better room if we chose to move. The room was clean, comfortable & quiet! The day manager also told us how to buy bus/metro passes & directed us to the local buses (only a block away or less) that took us to Las Ramblas, etc., plus all the major museums & sights that we were interested in. He also clued us into the best local restaurants serving "menu del dia". We couldn't have been more pleased! The local market across the street very accommodating. Really more than we expected. It sells everything..a combo market & drug store. It sells everything from bread, cheese, veggies & wine to cosmetics & sunscreen. We'd definitely stay here again & will recommend it to friends. Barcelona rocks & this is a nice place to stay! Great value for your dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: peefster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado for 3 days in July. We were a group of 6 and had 2 triple rooms. The first thing about the hotel is the location. It's just off diagonal avenue, which is one of the main roads in the city. Bus and metro connections are within reach with a couple of buses stopping pretty much right outside the hotel. The rooms were large and very clean. The bathrooms were also large enough and very clean. Free wifi was available in the hall. The only suggestion is that they keep kettles in the rooms as we had to constantly keep going down to reception to bring up pots of warm water. The breakfast buffet is also so so but there are two little cafes within a 5 min walk that served piping hot pastries and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: samisamet
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good (seemed to be recently refurnished) and also clean.metro and teain stations are approximately 10 minutes away from hotel.breakfast price is 12 euros are high. Receptionists are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: kiawah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights post cruise and selected the hotel based on previous reviews. We also did not want something in the busy area of town. We had a family suite with two bedrooms and bathrooms and a shared hallway area. It was perfect and the room size very adequate. They were very accomodating when we arrived and let us store our bags since our room was not ready. The staff was very friendly and helpful about places to eat and things to do. Our room did overlook the street and there was a bit of noise coming from the nightclub that was across the way but the windows have an extra pane of glass which did help. As previous reviews have mentioned, it is in a quiet neighborhood that feels very safe and is in walking distance to a couple of places to eat. We did our own thing for breakfast since the buffet price was a bit expensive for four people. We also did the Hop On and Off bus which was in walking distance to the hotel and a great way to get a feel for Barcelona. On the day of our departure, they arranged for a tax which was there when we came down to check out. I would stay here again and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, in a great neighborhood, fair walk to subway.”
Reviews.Author: TheMachineLe
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend for a first time Spain trip. Came in by AVE train, then took subway to nearest station. It is a good 10-15 minute walk to the hotel, a nice walk along Diagonal Street, yet not the most convenient if you want to walk out and go to the station. The hotel was nice size and very clean. Staff at the desk was extremely helpful and friendly. Recommended great places to eat and drink. The surrounding neighborhood is fantastic to stroll along and get a feel of true Barcelona life. Nearby bars and nightlife just a walk away. Shower was a little dark. No views from our room. Pretty quiet hotel to get your rest after staying up late from eating and going out late as the people Barcelona do everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: travelinfamily0f4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation in Europe capped off by a stay in Barcelona. The Condado Hotel was excellent. The room was very nice, clean, and surprisingly spacious. We are a family of 5 (kids 6, 4, and 1). We had the two rooms that open into a small lobby. It was really nice to have our own space. I had seen other reviews stating that it was small, but considering the size of accommodation throughout Europe, it was great - especially the bathrooms. The water in the hall was a great touch. The front desk was very helpful with all of our requests/questions. We never ate the breakfast, but opted instead to go to the market or the "Meatpacking Bistro" around the corner. It does require a walk to the metro to get to all the main sites, but it was still convenient (even with our young ones). Also just a short walk is the Maitea Taberna. A Trip Advisor recommended tapas restaurant that we very much enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “spacious & quiet”
Reviews.Author: kimxtom
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with Barcelona and I think having the Condado as our home base had a lot to do with it. Our room was modern, spacious and quiet. It would have been nice to have wi-fi in the room, but we could connect wired with our netbook and wi-fi in the lobby. The hotel is within walking distance of a metro stop (although it is a bit of a hike with luggage) and a couple of Gaudi's buildings. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but a bit far”
Reviews.Author: twinkiesaurus
Reviews.Content: This was a nice boutique hotel in the Zona Alta (just north of Diagonal Ave). The location is about 10-15 min walk to the metro, or about 30 min walk to tourist attractions - definitely a do-able stroll, but out of the way enough to deter you from returning to the hotel in the middle of the day to rest, which made it a bit tiring and inconvenient. Staff were professional, but brusque and I didn't feel comfortable asking a lot of questions. The room itself is nice, clean and modern, with a spacious bathroom. Free wifi is available in the lobby only (though we found our 1st-floor room was able to still get a decent signal). Free water provided in mini-fridges in the hallway!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: SAmTrax
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel based on its location and Tripadvisor reviews. Staff were helpful is varying degrees (from super friendly and forthcoming to somewhat indifferent), but then again they're not travel guides. Rooms were ok size, always well cleaned and quiet. There's (free) internet access via cable in the rooms and via WiFi in the lobby (there are also two terminals for the use of guests there). The elevators are tiny, but that's common due to restrictions with older buildings in Europe and not really an issue. We never had breakfast at the hotel, for what we required, we always found it better to have our croissants and coffee at some nearby café - there are plenty to chose from. For dining I agree with the other reviewer: avoid Moncho's and prefer Meatpacking, which is a more local experience (although it may involve a wait). We found the supermarket across the street disappointing - there is one named Caprabo 1.5 blocks away which is a lot better. Public transport is available at Diagonal (buses), one block away, and a 10-15 minute walk away at the intersection of Diagonal and Passeig de Gràcia there's metro. The tickets normally allow to connect within a 75 minute timeframe. Anyway, Barcelona is great to walk and frankly, when I go to a European city, I do expect to walk. There's an abundant number of ATMs within one block. We also noticed a redlight club a little down the street, but it was really not a nuisance - it was just there... In general, the area is very nice, not too touristy (unlike e.g. the Ramblas - and we never felt unsafe, even walking home at 3am)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Professional Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethbh
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Condado. We loved the room, the free water and internet and it was easy to get everywhere in Barcelona. The only complaint is that it costs $22/day to park! Had we known, we would not have rented a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and hope to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: sstrei2000
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel Condado before a cruise. It is a lovely hotel very close to many popular spots in Barcelona. Everyone in the hotel was extremely nice and helpful. Our rooms were ready after an early arrival in Barcelona. The rooms were clean and had the amenities necessary for a pleasant stay. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “re: Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ArmySpousechicagoil
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condado – Barcelona hotel@condadohotel.com Nice hotel, air conditioning worked really well. Great location, starbucks just up the street, market across the street. Maybe two blocks from Diagonal Avenue. Free internet, two free computers in the lobby with printer for guests. Free bottled water in the mini bar on each floor stocked daily. Downside, there are no refrigerators in the room but they will get you ice. Don't go to Monchos if they try sending you there. Buffet style - bad food and overpriced. 25 euro for a fatty piece of meat, should have checked trip advisor! :(

Reviews.Title: “Super - What more could one ask for !!!”
Reviews.Author: NatAar
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a family hotel in the centre of twon. We were 4 with our 2 lovely daughters. After a lot of looking around, as Barcelona hotels are generally full, we came across this super hotel. This hotel met all our expectations and more. It's very central. The bus drops you just right across the hotel. There is super market across the street. And lovely cafes, bars and eateries nearby. The rooms are very comfortable and very clean. Cleanliness is maintained throughout. Have already gone there once back again and look forward to be in Barcelona and in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous stay in comfort and security”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveling09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely a gem in our opinion. It is clean, modern and very comfortable. We stayed here as our 6th city of a two week Spain trip, and were absolutely impressed and delighted with the large modern rooms, including a good sized balconey and nice bathroom, as well as a closet area. We had requiested connecting quiet rooms, and the connection gave us an extra hallway to share. We were on the 6th floor with large usable balconies on the back courtyard; absolutely the quietest, most private set up we have enjoyed anywhere. The place seemed really well run and secure. One of our teens was under the weather and we were quite comfortable leaving him in the room on his own, as the front desk is always well staffed and the people there seem to know all the guests by site from the day they arrive. It was clean, comfy and secure. The staff had excellent English language skills and was always ready to help. While not in the famous tourist heart of town, we found the neighborhood full of food opportunities and convenient to buses with a short walk. If was much less frenetic and chaotic than the Ramblas area where our friends were staying, and we did not feel out of the heart of things at all. We would definitely stay here again and send all our friends here. A+! BTW: Don't bother with the hop-on, hop-off bus tours. They have long inconvenient routes, many of the stops are not very close to the sites they are named for, the audio tour is pitiful, and with all the trees along the roads there is not that much to be seen from the buses.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Barca”
Reviews.Author: hitchdovar
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Barca for many years and I really feel at home at Condado. Everyone who works here is nice and accommodating - my friends who only speak english have never had trouble with communication. I really love the rooms higher up - they are luxuriously spacious - the showers are so nice that I take two a day just to hang out in there. I've also stayed in the triple rooms, which are understandably more cramped, but a great bargain and often come with a lovely little smoking balcony. The hotel is well situated in lower Gracia - there are a bunch of clubs on the block (but they are easily ignored and not at all loud) - almost all the restaurants I want to eat at are a quick walk away in the eixample (about 15 mins walk from the bars in geixample) - shopping on the passeig de gracia is maybe 10 mins. I've never tried the food - I always eat out...

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: israelifamily
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely family vacation in Barcelona. The hotel being a bit far from the hustle was a feature, and not a bug. The hotel has a set of dbl rooms which are perfect for families who want to stay close and yet need the privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Far from metro”
Reviews.Author: Europhile23
Reviews.Content: The room was tastefully decorated and spacious. I greatly disliked the glass wall to the bathroom and sink outside bathroom which was awkward and provided no privacy! The front desk attendant did not seem to like answering questions for tourists. A big negative was the distance to nearest metro, about 15 minutes walk. It was quiet at night despite facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Amenities in Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: marteen239
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom are nice and modern. The hotel is set up for business travelers but also nice for leisure travelers. Free internet in the room is nice. The hotel staff answered questions but wasn't overly friendly. We booked a room with a balcony for an extra 20 euros a night which was definitely not worth it. The balcony's view is of the backs of other buildings. It is really there for people who want to go outside and smoke. Overall the room was a decent value for the price. If we go back to Barcelona, we would probably look for another option. The hotel is about four blocks from the metro. If you have a car, the hotel does offer a discounted rate to park the car at a nearby garage for 22 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Suldal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 25 - 28 of may and loved it! We stayed in the 7th floor and had a balcony with a lovely view! Very good service at the hotel. Clean and very nice hotelroom! This is not a 3 star hotel!! It has to be rated as a 4 star! Lots of nice restaurants near the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect fit...location, cleanliness, cost”
Reviews.Author: jcamis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights pre-cruise. It's located just north of Avenue Diagonal, about a 10-15 minute walk from Las Ramblas. For us this was a perfect location as it felt more like being in a local neighborhood than a high-traffic tourist area. The area felt completely safe, with all the amenities you could want nearby (supermarket, liqour store, coffee shops, restaurants, shopping, etc.). The hotel was a nice little boutique hotel, with good service and a decent-size room. The balcony was a plus, even with the smoking from a nearby balcony. One night instead of eating out we stopped at a little market, picked up cheese, meat and wine and dined al fresco on the balcony. The neighborhood to the north was a great find, mainly local and very quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great value, and easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: PhilRobinson63
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to by taxi and by bus, or even by foot down to La Rambla (20-30 minutes). Some good bars and restaurants within easy reach by foot too. Staff were very friendly and efficient at all times. Room clean, comfortable, good size, very large balcony / terrace. I n a fairly quiet part of town, so easy to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice, 7 nights, good location, good price,”
Reviews.Author: eddie_amore
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to BCN and 7 nights at the Condado. I had a very good stay at the hotel, the price, the location and about a 10 min walk to Passeo de Gracia, one of BCN nicest streets. I would recommend this hotel for sure, Jaime at the front desk was really helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, quiet, good price”
Reviews.Author: Troll22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. Room was quiet. Good price/quality ratio. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela5036
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 1 night pre cruise and 1 night after the cruise. The hotel is in a lovely area (l'Example). The hotel was modern and very clean, we were given superior rooms on both nights with balcony, the beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were of a good size and immaculate and very clean. We also had the breakfast which had a good choice of hot and cold items , fruit juices and coffee, although my friend was dissapointed there was no tea. I found the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful. We walked to Las Ramblas and took us about 35 mins but we were just strolling along enjoying the lovely views along the way. I would definately stay here again and I highly recommended it. Thank you to the manager Igncio Casellas who was very helpful and was quick in answering my emails with queries before we arrived in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: louisecc86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in late April. The positives: - very clean room - free bottled water available - comfy bed - very nice area (L'Eixample) The negatives: - sometimes quite surly reception service (we didn't really feel comfortable asking them for advice, although they did speak good English) - the hotel is not a 15 min walk to Las Ramlas... it is a 15 min walk to Rambla de Catalunya (this is where the nearest Metro stop is too) and to walk to Las Ramblas proper it takes about 25-30mins. We didn't mind so much as we enjoy walking but this was a bit unexpected for us. - the beds are not proper doubles, they are twins that can be zipped up into doubles - we were woken up very early each morning by the very loud sounds of the cleaning staff hefting furniture in rooms above, below and next to us. While they did a very good job, this meant we never really got a proper holiday lie-in... - we got a superior double so we would get a balcony. The balcony didn't have a view really nor did it get the sun. I suspect what made it a superior room was that it was at the back of the property so got minimal noise from the bars/clubs on the street at the front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PipistrelloAndPanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter, and got a good discount on our four night stay. The room was clean and although small, well designed (enough surfaces for toiletries, etc) and the bed and pillows were comfortable. Decor is inoffensive, the usual corporate, slightly bland hotel decor. Double glazed windows meant we had no problem with noise in the street. It is 15 minutes' walk from the nearest metro stops, which you should factor in if you do not like walking, or you are visiting in winter. After a day's hard touring, we found it too far to go into town to eat supper (if you were willing to take taxis, this would not be a problem). There were a couple good restaurants and tapas places 10-15 minutes' walk from the hotel, esp. Cerveceria Catalana and La Bodequeta. Nice upmarket neighbourhood, lots of bakeries for breakfast on the go and window shopping. Staff were polite but like staff everywhere in Barcelona, were not warm or friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Oldham74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Condado for 3 nights last month on a leisure trip to fantastic Barcelona. We got a taxi from the airport as we were unsure as to which bus to get to the centre. It cost us 35 euros to the Condado which i thought was quite expensive (everything is in Barcelona!) but i asked the hotel reception about the cost of the taxi & they confirmed this was indeed about the right price. If you don't want to pay the price of a taxi there is a airport shuttle bus that leaves something like every 15 minutes which makes several stops on it's way to the Place de Catalunya (this is the bus we found out about when we were flying back home & it cost 6 euros each & took about 35 minutes). The hotel is decent quality with a very nice lobby area & reception. The staff are mostly very helpful & friendly. There is indeed a constant supply of free bottled water which is a nice touch & very welcome. There is internet available. I was on the trip with my grandma & we both had twin rooms on the 4th floor. I think the room nos were 411 & 417. My room 411 had a nicer shower area than my grandmas room because i had a window in there whereas my grandmas didn't which was a pity as it made it look pokey. Along with this, the shower in my grandmas room was actually stuck right in the corner & actually not very inviting (i did offer to swap rooms with my grandma but we decided to stay put). Both rooms had a window but with no view unfortunately. My room was reasonably bright & airy with the window open but my grandmas was quite dark even with the curtain drawn. If i thought there were other rooms available i may have asked reception for a change of room for my grandma as i was quite dissapointed with it but i already kenw the hotel was fully booked. However we spent most of our time out of the rooms exploring the city & would return to my room in the evening for a drink before retiring. When in Barcelona it is a must to use the city tour bus (there are 2 to choose from but they are basically the same i believe). There is a stop not far from the Condado Hotel. TIP Before you pay to get on the tour bus please make a note to first acquire a discount coupon! We did not know about the discount until we saw other people using them when getting on the bus. Thankfully a lady gave us on of her groups discount tickets & this saved us 6 euros off the cost of the tour bus! When i asked her where did she get the discount coupons from she said her hotel. The Condado does not have these coupons available & if you buy the tour bus tickets from reception you will pay the full price so you should go find them before using the tour bus & save yourselves 6 euros each (possibly available at the tourist information office?). As other people have said the hotel is a little too far out of the centre but i guess this is the price you pay for the cheaper option accommodation. Next time i return to Barcelona (for the 6th time) i would spend the extra just to be nearer to the centre of things as it can be quite a long tiring walk back to the Condado in the evening. There are a few restaurants, cafes & shops around the hotel but still not a great amount of choice & we did not find a restaurant nearby we fancied. We did find a nice little local bar on the next street along from the Condado with seating outside & i would recommed you go there for an evening drink as they are very friendly & the service is good. Apart from this we did use a local cafe for morning coffee & the nearby Starbucks. There is a good supermarket nearby which you can enter from either the hotel side or the local bar side. TIP Everything seems expensive in Barcelona however we did find one bargain. It is the wine in the supermarket. You can buy a 1 litre box of wine for just 99 cents. Less than 1 euro for a 1 litre carton of wine! Red or white. It is very nice too. So i recommend this as for one small glass of wine or beer in the nearby bar costs around 3 euros. Overall we were satisfied with the Condado on this occasion but would spend the extra & stay nearer to the action next time. Final thoughts:- Slept well in my comfy bed. Liked the shower (in my room not in my grandmas). Nice wardrobes with automatic lighting. Good quality Grundig LCD TVs. Door keys are very difficult to get used to. No fridge in room. No clocks in room. Good 3 star but prefer 4 star next time for the extras.

Reviews.Title: “clean quiet hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: RachelBurstow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two children aged 9 and 14.We had a family suite consisting of two rooms which connected via a small lobby which you could lock so that people could not enter from the corridor. The rooms bedding and bathrooms were spotlessly clean and of high standard. Despite the double glazing there was quite a lot of street noise , partcularly around 4am ish which seemed to be getting louder as the week progressed . Not unexpected in a city break but people with young children may want to have rooms at the rear as it did wake our two. The only downside to this hotel was that the breakfast was charged at 12 euros each which makes it a fairly expensive affair. We were not charged for our daughter which was very kind so perhaps people with young children may not have to pay for them - 12 euros for a yogurt would be steep! The breakfast was very good and varied although we did go to the supermarket opposite one morning to buy juice, yogurts and pain au chocolat - all of which came to 10 euros for all 4 of us. The staff were very friendly and helpful - I did miss the coffee and tea making facilities but I guess that's an English thing! There were free bottles of water outside in the corridor which was useful - the fridge although plugged in was not cold though so the water was warm! There is free wifi in the foyer and 2 computers for use . The hotel was in a fairly good location for most things - Barcelona is so vast you would never be perfectly situated for everything and taxis are cheap so we used them a lot. There was only one thing that spoiled my stay which was that my hair dye came off on the pillows so the last night they didn;t provide me with one - just the inner! I can see that they would be a bit miffed about their white pillowcases being soiled but I wish they had at least told me rather than just express their disapproval in this way. It made me feel very unwelcome and uncomfortable on the last day and they must be used to far worse problems. However this wouldn't affect the majority of you who have normal hair - anyone with transferable hair colours though beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LOppenheimer
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at Hotel Condado over 2 years. Check-in is fast. They seem to retain their staff, because I always find the same people at the reception. Always friendly and attentive, and very prompt. The location is great, with an easy walk to the shopping areas, which makes it less congested. Good supermarket right across the street. Easy transportation and staff eager to provide directions. The rooms are a bit small, but very smartly designed and kept spotless. They provide free internet services (cable) in all rooms, and lower level rooms receive free wi-fi, which is also readily accessible in the lobby area. The lobby is equipped with 2 desktops and a printer (free of charge). Unfortunately the sound proofing is not as good as it could be, and if you have noisy neighbors, this can be a problem, though the front desk is always a resource

Reviews.Title: “Fine quiet hotel, just outside of the city centre”
Reviews.Author: sander66
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a city trip. It's quiet (we asked for an inner room) and just out of the hasle of the ramblas. 24/7 open. It is a 15 minute walk to the ramblas, but it is easy to take a cheap taxi. Plenty restaurants and bars in the direct neighbourhood. Staff speaks excellent English, rooms are clean, not all too big. We had a small balcony too. We had no breakfast in the hotel, plenty bars where you can order cheap breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: brightonbelle27
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as my partner was attending a conference in the Gothic quarter of the city. Please be aware that this hotel is slightly away from the main touristy area - but this has its own advantage as there are several nice restaurants close by for an evening meal, for us it was an ideal location. This is a quality three star hotel with very clean and comfortable rooms. along with helpful and informative staff. We asked for a high floor and got a quiet room with large balcony at the back of the hotel, sleep quality excellent. There are two fridges on each floor containing complimentary small bottles of water, which is a good touch too. Did not try the breakfast at 12 euro but food smells were pleasant. Absolutely no hesitation in staying here again. Diagonal metro station (which has lots of services) is around 12 min walk away or if you fancy the walk down to Las Ramblas area then allow 30-40 minutes. A T10 card is a must if you need to use the metro frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in central loctation”
Reviews.Author: taycosmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights over weekend. We had standard room, which was quite big and modern looking with it own outdoor terrace, the bathroom had shower area which was very big and the bed was comfy, there is also an internet cable in the room by the desk to connect to for free internet which was very useful! We did not have breakfast at the hotel but there is severals place to eat nearby and a supermarket just across the road which saved us a lots of money during the holiday. There is several bus routes and tram nearby, but the main metro station is just ten mins walk away . The service and help at the hotel was very good and the cleaning quality was great. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who want to stay in central Barcelona and nearby to everything. A++

Reviews.Title: “Really good, if simple, hotel....decent service. Breakfast is a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel and the neighbourhood in which it was located. It is true that it may be a little further from the tourist spots, but transportation is very close, and cabs are reasonable in Barcelona. The rooms (I think we had 602) are very clean with quite a bit of storage and space to put your bags. Our bathroom was quite large. The beds were comfy and we never had a big issue with hotel noise so slept pretty well. They is a night club across the street which did get load, but this is not really the hotels fault. The fridges with free water that were located on each floor were great. Better internet connectivity (wifi) would be a big plus if it was available but it is in the lobby along with a couple of computers. Breakfast was a bit expensive at e12 but this is almost aways the case with hotel breakfasts in Spain, and really, around the world. I did eat there once as it was handy, but there are a lot of options around the hotel. Desk staff were good and let us check in early and check out late as both my wife and I were feeling ill for a lot of our trip. They were helpful and patient and we had no troubles communicating or getting advice. All in all a very good stay and we would stat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Metusalem
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condado provide a good service, has a very helpful staff and the rooms are fine. We would definitely recommend this hotel. The location is good compared to most attractions. There is a supermarket opposite the hotel and an "El-Fornet" where to eat baguettes and drinking freshly squeezed juice as an alternative to the hotel's breakfast or lunch. Do not forget to visit Palau de la Musica. Together with Gaudi's buildings, making this vacation in Barcelona to something special.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for some”
Reviews.Author: Thelockes
Reviews.Content: We just got back from two nights at this hotel. We were very pleased with the booking as it served our purposes well. Our room (509) was clean and recently decorated. The location of the hotel means you will proably need to walk some to get to metro stations or the attractions but for us that was no problem. The attractions in Barcelona are spread out. The desk staff were very helpful with our touring requirements.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful value and a great Barcelona experience!!”
Reviews.Author: lindabNewportNewsVa
Reviews.Content: We researched hotels in Barcelona to stay in prior to our Med cruise. We found the Hotel Condado on this site and the price and reviews sold us on the hotel. We took a cab from the airport (26 euros) and enjoyed the ride to the hotel. Barcelona is a beautiful and quaint city. When we arrived at the hotel, it took just a few minutes to check in. We were on the 7th floor and was in our room in minutes. As we entered the room, I thought it was small but quite modern. Then I looked further out the window and saw they had given us a room with a beautiful balcony ove looking the sites of the Gracia area of Barcelona. We had a table and two chairs on the balcony and spent each evening relaxing with a glass of wine! Thank you Condado! The room was immaculate and the bathroom was set up with three private areas, One, a large shower which had great water pressure. There was also a private toilet area and an area with a large sink and mirror. The room was quiet and outside there was a fridge with bottled water for free. Downstairs there was an area with free wifi and a breakfast area. Across the street there was a market with everything you would need from food to wine to toiletries. We went there daily to get fresh bread and meats for our breakfast. The area has many restaurants and shops. Around the corner there is a Starbucks if you want fresh coffee. Buy a T10 metro ticket. I see people complaining about the metro. Well the front desk told us what bus to take where and we just used the bus. There is a stop across the street. Take bus no. 64 to get down to the Las Ramblas area or the waterfront or just to see the city. After a day or two you get the idea of where things are...it is not a difficult city to get around in. Take a day and go to Montserrat. Take the train from the Placa Epana - you can get a ticket that includes the train, rack train and lunch for 36 euros. This is a must see. Any way, the Condado is in a fine area, away from the noise of Las Ramblas and you get to mingle with the locals and not the tourists. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location, very clean, quiet and smart rooms with very comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: potato86
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! Excellent value and all round good quality hotel. The rooms were very clean and beds extremely comfortable. Although there were no coffee making facilities, it was no problem at all as there are plenty of fantastic cafes just a few doors away. You are spoilt for choice with restaurants within easy walking distance, and the metro and train stations just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, `5 min. walk from placa catalonia and the ramblas, near diagonal and gracia neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ofer4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not located at the center of the tourist attraction , 15 min walk . very clean hotel, very deacent and helpfull service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but way out of the way and not tourist friendly area”
Reviews.Author: chelanhearts
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong the Condado was a good hotel for the money but was in the Catalunya part of Barcelona. This area does not seem to be very receptive to non speaking Catalunians (different dialect of Spanish) and is far from Las Rambla and the port. As a tourist you will want to be in the La Rambla area. if you are on business you might be fine at the Condado. First night there my daughter and I went to the grocery store across the street and were followed around the store by a very agressive security guard, after we had ask him a question in english. On our way out he implied that we had taken something without paying. It was mind blowing and when we tried to have a man translate for us he refused to allow the man to speak english to us. Oh well, so life goes on! We checked out of the Condado and stayed a block from La Rambla at the "Hotel Lleo". It was clean, the room spacious, and the area friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice hotel - just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: IN90
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room for 3 nights in the run-up to Christmas ans we enjoyed our stay at the Condado Hotel. Cleanliness: The hotel was spotless from the lobby to the bed-room and bath room. Cleaned daily. Location: The hotel is located in a nice area just off Avenuda Diagonal. If I could fault the hotel's location, it would be that the nearest metro is a 15 minute walk away. However, there are many buses which can take you along Diagonal towards the metro. If you are fit and enjoy walking, you can walk to many of the famous attractions from the hotel within a 40 minutes radius. Barcelona is beautiful seen on foot. Rooms: We opted for the triple as there were three of us and these were hard to come-by in Barcelona, until we stumbled across the Condado Hotel. We had two single beds and a rollaway bed. The room was standard sized and had two basins located in the bedroom as opposed to the bathroom. There was enough wardrobe and surface space.
