Service: Our room was cleaned daily and to a high standard. We never had to wait long at reception and upon check-out our luggage was stored for us and labelled for safe return later on in the day. Value: It was the cheapest hotel offering a triple room and was good value for money. Sleep quality: We were shattered most days so fell asleep as soon as our heads hit our pillows. You can hear people in the next room when they talk loudly, but the noise level was standard and acceptable for a hotel. General comments/tips: The Mercadona Supermarket is located opposite the hotel and sells everything you might need for a low price (full of locals). Obtain a T-10 card (7.95 EURO) if you wish to travel a lot using public transport to get around the city - handy on getting to and from the airport also. If you enjoy walking and only getting public transport at the start and end of the day, a T-10 roughly lasts you for a 3 day trip. Generally public transport is easy to use. If you are below the age of 25, you can get a discounted entry to certain attractions, e.g. Picasso Museum, so bring your Student PhotoID. Although we fortunately never encountered any pick-pockets, we did keep our wits about us. For a day-trip try MontSerrat - we enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Hazeleeno
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean and good bathroom. Free water in the mini bar was a great and welcome touch in the summer heat! Close to metro and excellent base for sightseeing. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms, breakfast and free water”
Reviews.Author: charlie115
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in November 2010 in a superior room, was not as big as we were hoping but had balcony, great shower and bath and beds were very comfortable. We basically walked around the city from here not using the metro and you can reach most things on foot if you are fit and like walking! Each floor had free water to drink although it did tend to run out quite quickly. Breakfast was fantastic very good selection and good quality. Waiter was efficient although not the most friendly character! The biggest problem we had in Barcelona was trying to find a nice spanish restuarant which also had a nice atmosphere. There are plenty of japanese/chinese restuarants but most spanish restuarants were very brightly lit, smoky or looked extremely touristy with pictures of each dish stuck on the window. We gave up in the end and had a meal in one of the above described spanish restaurants, food was very good but atmosphere was awful! For the second night we did eventually find somewhere decent looking but when we enquired they said they werent opening until 8.00, it was 7.00pm at this stage. We found a french restaurant around the corner which was great - Brasserie flo barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: andrewinmadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Condado for the second time in late October 2010. Location: The Hotel is located in the Diagonal area of Barcelona, a 10 minute walk or so from the Diagonal Metro, from which you can be in the city center in a stop or two. The Diagonal area is much quieter , than the Plaza Cataluyna or La Rambla area. Diagonal is a very classy part of town, with highend shopping and alot of good restaurants. The Hotel: The Hotel Condado is very modern, and clean. The staff as usual was very helpful, They have complimentary water bottles which is a nice benefit as you head out each day, and there are two free internet stations with a printer in the lobby. The Breakfast: Breakfast consisted of assorted meats, cheeses, cereals, muffins, eggs, bacon and sausage. It was a pretty good start for the day, also if you like cupcakes check out a place maybe 5 minutes away called Cup and Cake, excellent boutique cupcake shop, my wife and I stopped there everymorning for a 2nd breakfast :) My only complaints are that the free water bottle fridges didn't seemed to get refilled as often as they should, and I found many times that other guests had put there personal food in the fridges. Also the hotel lacks a bar, and their restaurant does not sell wine. Overall I would definitely reccommend the Hotel Condado, especially if you what to be able to escape the crazyness of the city center while you sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trish005
Reviews.Content: Hotel was all we expected. Check In - Fast and efficient. Room - Exceptionally clean. Lots of Storage. Bathroom - Again, exceptionally clean ( and we are fusspots about bathrooms!) There was a Safe, balcony with table/2chairs. Air conditioning worked. About a 10-15 min walk to Metro ( no problem as we all need more exercise!) or bus stops very close. Free Internet and Printer off the lobby ( so handy for on-line check in!) Hotel staff helpful with answers to questions. Could recomment to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Christines-trips
Reviews.Content: The Conrado Hotel is a modern and nice independent hotel a little out of the main tourist area. The neighbourhood around Aribau and Diagonal is quite elegant neighbourhood with smart old townhouses and businesses. There are great restaurants and bars nearby that are not your typical "tourist traps" and visited by lots of locals. The room was spacious enough and nicely furnished. However, be aware that the Hotel is located opposite a night club and next to few bars. Our first room on the second floor out to the main road was very noisy to the early hours (it was a Saturday night). The friendly reception staff moved us to room facing the back the next morning, which was lovely and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel,a little out of the main area but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Anchorsaway005
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, a little out of the main area but worth it. The rooms and facilities were great, we even had a balcony. The hotel is a ten minute walk to the nearest Subway station which was a minor issue. Free Hi Speed Broadband and bottled water. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean rooms uptown. Perhaps for seasoned traveller and not first timer to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DXA911
Reviews.Content: Excellent and clean renovated rooms - we selected this hotel from the reviews on this site. As expected, it is somewhat out of the way for a first time visitor to Barcelona. So if you are in Barcelona for your first time, this may not be as good a location. Otherwise, the neighbourhood is just very comfortable. It is safe and full of local characteristics. If I have to go back for a second time visit, i will choose this. It is difficult to get to this hotel from the airport by train. We tried by train and follow the instruction written by earlier writers and hotel responses(es). We took the Renfe train from terminal 2 to Passig del Garcia. We failed to realized we have to do two more transfers to get to Garcia station on line L7 and walk another 4 blocks. naturally our adventurous spirit was tested for over 1/2 hours walking in the wrong direction onto Rla d. Catalunya. We ended up taking a 7 euro taxi ride to the hotel. That is OK, it is all about learning the system and part of the travel experience. If you want to use the internet provided by the hotel, bring ethernet cable. Hotel provides such cable for your use.but you have to get it from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, helpful staff - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Elle2010_10
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to friends and would be glad to visit again. The location is good for walking around Eixample and to the Sagrada Familia / Park Guell. Felt very safe walking back from town late at night and a comfortable walk from the nearest Metro stop. The rooms were stylish and elegantly simple, with TV (Spanish channels), plenty of cupboard space and electronic safe. The room had two twin beds (very comfortable) and clean wooden floors. The bathroom had an amazing shower, up-to-date clean tiling and crucial hairdryer! Our room had a small window onto the internal light-well, but was adequately lit by the numerous lamps. It was an incredibly quiet room to sleep in. The maid did a great job of keeping the room clean. There was an air-conditioning unit (very quiet) which would be useful in the summer months. There is a small lift to all floors, comfotable meeting area in the foyer and communal fridge/mini-bar on each floor. The staff were professional, polite and hospitable. They were tolerant of our lack of Spanish linguistic skills and there always seemed to be at least one staff member that spoke good English. We didn't eat in the hotel but there is a good supermarket opposite and several cafes within a few minutes walk (we would recommend the welcoming and delicious El Fornet on the same road). We had a fantastic stay at this hotel and I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, free wifi, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: okutake
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our 30's and just returned from a two week trip to Spain (which was awesome). The Hotel Condado was our first stop of the trip. We arrived early so we checked our bags in and hit the city on foot. Initially we were a bit concerned about some road work (jackhammer) directly in front of the hotel that was deafening. Turned out to be a total non-issue since all work ceased by the afternoon. The location of the hotel is a good center for exploring the Gracia and Eixample districts around Ave Diagonal. The Metro is about 400m down the Diagonal. The room was clean and pretty much had everything you'd need. Our view wasn't good (the roof + other walls/windows) but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, just to sleep. The nice thing is that there is free wifi and free water in mini-fridges on each floor (I'm assuming - I didn't check each floor) and in the lobby. There is a restaurant on the first floor but didn't try it as there is a nice bakery around the corner called "Bopan". There is also a small market across the street and a couple bars close-by. Overall the Condado was a good hotel. We would have preferred a hotel a little closer to the Metro but it's really not that far.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 3301westward
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condado is a very nice hotel, just a block or so from the main east/west boulevard, Avinguda Diagonal. Avinguda Diagonal is a beautiful boulevad, with a tree-lined pedistrian walk down the middle--with high end shopping along its length. Like other European hotels, the bed sits low, has a thin bedspread, and isn't made up with a blanket (that's separately provided in a drawer by the desk). You'll have to share soap and drinking cups, or ask for extras. No refrigerator is included, although there is a community one in the hallway that provides bottled water. Nicely furnished, beautiful lobby and restaurant (apparently serves only breakfast). The staff was very helpful, and provided a very rapid response to e-mails we had sent after our trip was over (trying, with success, to retrieve a lost camera).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hefbed
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, very reasonably priced, clean, safe, in a quiet downtown location, a short walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and outdoor cafes. The staff is multilingual and very cooperative. This hotel would be an ideal base if you need several days to explore Barcelona or simply to use for a day prior to or after a cruise. It is European style and refreshingly not North American!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, intimate Hotel, away from the crowds!!”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosER
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. The Hotel is in a quiet area away from the noise and bustle of The Ramblas. Our double room and bathroom were both very clean, hairdryer was a very useful touch, and the small balcony was an added bonus. The breakfast room was lovely and airy, good selection of breakfast items, staff always available to keep buffet replenished. Reception staff were all very helpful, just remember if you don't speak spanish, explaining what you need clearly helps. We walked into the centre every day, took us about 45 mins to an hour, depending on how many coffee stops we had!! We personally liked walking around the city, there is so much to see, especially when you go down the smaller side streets. Loads of really good restaurants close by, buses, metro and taxis readily available. Would thoroughy recommend this Hotel, and would be happy to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrf25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. We stayed two nights in July so we could be in Spain for their historic World Cup victory. Our room was beautiful, air-conditioned, big comfy bed and long bathtub with shower in the quite large bathroom. Balcony with table and chairs was a nice plus. The room had a good-sized desk with Internet access. The hotel was not a bad walk to/from Las Ramblas, and the Diagonale metro station (though it is a few hundred meters to the Metro and at least a kilometer to Las Ramblas, the streets were a very nice walk). Lovely quiet neighborhood, great staff. We highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Boutique Hotel in the center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay in the center of Barcelona. The 76 room hotel offers personalized and attentive service, excellent and spacious rooms, and a wonderful respite from impersonal chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but slightly out of the way”
Reviews.Author: jim1664
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado with friends in April 2010 and found it to be quite a nice hotel with very helpful staff when we needed them. The hotel is a little out of the way and is a dark which the hotel have tried to make a feature of it seems. The rooms were clean and well decorated and modern. The one downside is that the hotel claim that there are complimentary drinks supplied these however are in a fridge in the corridor and no matter what time of day we checked there were never any drinks within the fridge- the fridge was also dirty and the same stains inside the fridge were there throughout our stay! All in all a decent enough hotel if slightly out the way. Probably wouldn't stay there again though as there is loads of choice nearer the action.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Reception”
Reviews.Author: ceto8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. After reading the reviews in TA, I booked the hotel with so much expectations. And I would say I was quite disappointed. I printed out a promotion voucher for an upgrade of room from TA last August and presented it at the reception upon checkin. It was ignored and I was simply told that we were already given an upgraded room which is not true. The location is not that great. We asked for direction from the reception 3-4 times and each time we were given a short answer that is vague, with no details of the street names, landmarks, or to which direction is the bus going to. 15 - 20 mins walk to Diagonal Metro is quite a long walk. If you wait for the bus, it's sometimes a long wait especially on weekends. And now, I read a reply in TA from the Management that the closest metro station is Gracia which is about 5-7 minutes walking distance. No one ever told us this when we were asking for the nearest Metro. The receptionists were not very helpful nor friendly...answering your queries with short answers lacking of important details made me feel unwelcomed. There were 2 small common fridge in each level, but since these were full most of the time, your food & drinks don't really get cold. And also because of this, there were only a few free bottled water that can fit into the small fridge. I would rather have a fridge in my room where I can store my food & drinks. The room is clean, the bathroom is quite small, the free cabled internet in our room is good (but not that ideal as it is not wireless so only one computer can be use at a time), and the best is the 2 computer with printer at the lobby. After comparing the hotels where we stayed for more than 3 weeks, I would say Hotel Condado is just average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocky527
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights. The hotel staff is very helpful, breakfast is great. It is very well connected by bus to the city center (Placa Catalunya). Great local eataries, markets all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huge_K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights while visitng Barcelona. The hotel is reasonably priced with a good breakfast and free internet. The rooms and bathrooms are a good size and the hotel is quite modern and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is likely 2 kms to the Gaudi houses and great locations for tapas and strolling. It is quite a walk to the Ramblas. For us who like to walk, it was located fine. We took the underground back up near the hotel at night. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: MaestraViajera
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my recent stay at Hotel Condado in Barcelona. I was with a party of 5 and we had 3 total rooms. The rooms were comfortable and it was truly a lovely hotel. There is high speed internet available and the location is such that it is easy to get to many of the main city attractions with minimal cost. The bus will also take you directly to and from the train station which is a great bonus. There are many lovely restaurants and shops nearby and the neighborhood is quiet and easy to navigate. There were some issues with customer service and a couple of the receptionists, particularly in regards to foreigners, however after communication with the manager I assured that they have been resolved. Overall this is a wonderful hotel to stay at if you plan to visit beautiful Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Greate hotel with a good location!”
Reviews.Author: mrJapco
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel in September 2009. Rooms are really nice and cozy. Bad is very comfortable. Service was excellent and very helpful. Hotel is located next to Diagonal Street – one of the biggest in Barcelona – so there is a lot of bus stops and metro stations. If you are traveling by a car you have a parking in front of the hotel. Breakfasts were good, but nothing special. Although breakfasts are served in rooms for no extra fee, do not take it. You will get only one piece of bread with a slice of ham and cheese. I liked an idea of serving free cold soft drinks! It was really nice after whole day in a sun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms in a safe, quiet neighborhood, 15-20 minute walk to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: scwdns
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room at this hotel, which was actually two seperate rooms with a common entrance. The rooms were extremely nice, the staff accomodating, and the neighborhood quiet and safe, and the price affordable. The only downside was the 15-20 minute walk to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejmktravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Condado Hotel Barcelona at the last minute. Given the positive reviews on tripadvisor.com we figured it would be a good option for our short stay in Barcelona. The hotel exceeded our expectations. What a treat! We had a lovely room with a terrace on a high floor. The room was sleek, modern and very comfortable (fantastic shower!). We greatly appreciated the complimentary bottled water in the hallways. While the amenities and location are great, the thing that sets this hotel apart is the amazing staff! We only stayed for 2 days, but every request we made was answered promptly and with a smile. They mailed our postcards for us, gave us an internet cable to connect our laptop in our room, and even lent us a corkscrew! One of the best hotel experiences we have had in a long time. Thanks to the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Service at the center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: erenbeskardes
Reviews.Content: That was a very good experience at the center of Barcelona. We'd walked everywhere in the city. And also it is a very secure place to stay, and also quiet at nights. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. And also Barcelona is a must to be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Condado does the job”
Reviews.Author: Lesley M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado twice during our trip to Spain this summer, the first time we were given a massive room with a balcony which was clean and looked like new.The only minuses being no tea making facilities in the room and the mini bar is shared by the whole floor(it is out on the landing) this is crazy as most of the time there was no water in it! People actually stored their own food in it! I cannot see why there couldn't be a mini bar in the room. Also plastic cups were non existent in the room, hard if you wanted them to clean your mouth etc. Apart from that they did keep our bags on early check in and when we checked out the second time,so that was good! The second time we had a much smaller room with no balcony ,it was ok for a few days but if you were staying longer it would have been constricting.Overall an average hotel which is near to buses but far from a metro(20 mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel fit our needs perfectly!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieandStig
Reviews.Content: We knew nothing about Barcelona so Travel Advisor came to our rescue! Our visit was after a cruise in April. We wanted a CLEAN room, in a SAFE neighborhood, that was QUIET, and near restaurants and transportation to the downtown area. We got it all and then some. The room was amazing clean and well kept. There is no good t.v. but we could get some BBC for news and weather. Very modern. Be sure to get directions and a map at the front desk. The staff was helpful, but my 2 prong European plug didn't fit into the recessed Spanish recepticle. I could not find an adaptor for the 4 days we were there so I had no curling iron, and no camera after the 2nd day because we couldn't recharge it. Bummer! That was a big disappointment. We had a big window that opened up into the inside open quadrant of the hotel so no windows looked into ours. We left the window open all night. The only noise was the sound of rain! It was humid and the hallways were very warm. The air conditioning was good but preset at the desk. We would have liked it a little cooler but we managed with the open window and the air. I am not sure how good it would be in the summer when it gets really warm! There was a little 'frig outside in the hall with ice cold water, but it empties by mid morning and you need to get water down at the front desk. The elevator was tiny and there was only room for 3 people or 1 person with bags. But who cares? It was functional and there was another small elevator around the corner in the hall. The surprise was a little supermarket right across the street. We could fill up with snacks to take for the day . That was great!!! It is 2 blocks to the shopping area and transportation hub. There is also a Starbucks up there where we bought coffee and sandwiches. Wish we had also known about Bopan. We bought the 2 day ticket for the double decker bus, BUT IT STARTED 3 DAYS OF RAIN the next day and- first -you can't sit upstairs or outside (obviously) and- second -the windows inside are all fogged up and YOU CAN"T SEE A DAMN THING! BORING! The bus tour is great outside but be sure you check the weather report before you buy your 2 day ticket. The second day you may be out of luck. As a result, we got out and walked everywhere with an umbrella. We got to see more but we got soaked (So the curling iron turned out to be unnecessary anyway). The photos were grey and bleak and the camera got wet. Guess we need a second try at Barcelona. We loved the Cathedrals and museums there and our favorite place was the Gaudi Park. At least the first day was sunny and warm. There is complimentary access to a computer which was a God send as we were trying to get out of Europe before the Icelandic volcano belched out more smoke and ash (we were flying home through London.) The last night we walked up to the corner and turned right and walked down 2 blocks to a wonderful Italian restaurant on the corner. Very close and very good. We tried to get on a bus to go to a 13th century Monastery that was fairly close but we found most bus drivers don't speak English and DON"T WANT YOU TO ASK QUESTIONS OR BOTHER THEM! So we got lost, got off the bus and walked down to the port and walked back on the Ramblas. Ouch! Barcelona is a beautiful city with a lot to see. We will return to the Hotel Condado someday. It served our needs nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Truly recommend this Hotel Condado in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: serena048
Reviews.Content: After staying in a hole in the wall in Paris, I was wary of the hotel in Barcelona. I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, air-conditioned, spacious with the average bathroom amenities such as a shower cap. The staff were business-like but helpful. They suggested a restaurant around the corner for my last evening which met expectations. The hotel is not in city centre but near all transportation and in quiet, safe area. After no air conditioning in 90+ weather in Paris hotel, it was heaven to stay in this hotel, since it was also 90+ in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: kash05
Reviews.Content: To start off getting to the hotel is not too complicated. Took the airport bus and then changed at Universitat to another city bus that stopped right in front of the hotel. You can get the directions from airport tourist information. Also will have to buy a bus pass would highly recommend getting a pass with 10 trips. The hotel itself was very clean, the rooms very well kept and modern, and staff was reasonably friendly and provided us with any directions we needed. There is a bus stop within 5 minutes where you can take a bus to the city center. It was actually very convenient and would highly recommend just using the bus. There is a metro station too nearby but its a 15 minute walk. The neighborhood is quite clean, safe and quiet. You can also walk to city center "La Rambla" if feeling adventurous. Its about a 45 minute walk. Would also highly recommend a small cafe near the hotel called Bopan. Had the best coffee and pastries. Always started our day there ! A lot of people in the reviews mentioned that the hotel is too far from city center but we found that it was just a 10 minute bus ride to city center and quite convenient. Also we were able to get buses from near by to all the tourist attractions including Parc Guell. PS. There is complementary water bottles in the lobby fridges which was really cool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: CarolDIB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 16th-20th August. Booked the hotel after reading comments by other reviewers on this site and were not disappointed. The hotel was lovely and kept very clean. Room was a good size and well furnished in a modern style. As already stated the free bottles of water provided, in the mini bars in the hallways, were a nice touch - especially in the August heat. Safe also very useful. We booked B&B and found the breakfast room lovely and the food good. The reception staff were all friendly and helpful. As a couple in our mid 50s we found it a bit of a walk to the metro in the heat, but we hope to return to this hotel some day.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, mountains, shopping, and GAUDI!”
Reviews.Author: Drewjo1437
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is so beautiful, it's like walking in a live canvas. Art is everywhere! The Condado hotel is off the main street, Diagonal, and shopper's beware - this is the Fifth Avenue/ Rodeo Drive of Barcelona! Ladies beware, you'll want to buy everything you see in every shop window! On that note - the Condado is about a ten minute walk from the nearest, most convenient metro station. The rooms are small but trendy, although the green, glass, see-thru bathroom door takes a minute to get used to. If you're travelling with someone you are not that close with, it could be an issue. Those free-spirits who can poop in front of anyone - rock on! The hotel has smartly taken part in energy reduction by requiring your room key to operate the electricity in the room. This is done by placing the key in a switch on the entry wall. The small downside is there is no clock in the room. (The time would always be wrong!) Also, there is no iron in the hotel. (Evidently a norm throughout Spain). It is quite pricey to have the hotel iron a garment for you. There is no fridge in the room either, however, there are two located near the elevators on each floor, for community use, as well as one in the hotel lobby that is equipped with complimentary water daily. The king size mattress is actually two twins, made up separately, and joined together on a king size frame. The mattress itself is like sleeping on a cinderblock. But the room did have a balcony, which was a great feature, and the rooms are nice and quiet, especially for such a well populated neighborhood. The staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Like most hotels, the buffet breakfast offered is ridiculously priced. There are many, many options for a continental breakfast in easy walking distance (Atleast 4 options just within one block). However, Americans beware, there is not a scrambled egg to be found anywhere, seemingly near or far. Ham lovers, you'll be in pork heaven! All in all, the Condado was a great value for us. It is beautifully designed, the free internet and printing was fantastic, and the complimentary water was used daily (for those walks to the metro). Everyone will love Diagonal, and if you turn on Passage Gracie (misspelled), another well appointed shopping bonanza, you can be at the beach in another 15-20 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloBill46
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with a family room. This meant two actual rooms with an outer door to make it a two room suite. Rooms were clean, quiet and well decorated. Staff was courteous and helpful. Front desk saw me waiting for others to get off complimentary computers so I could print my boarding passes. They told me they would call when free. Not only did the call a few minutes later, but they sat at the computer so no one else would take it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good`, quiet location - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lucyc84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on a trip to Barcelona with my mother to celebrate her birthday. Before our arrival the manager was incredibly helpful in arranging a bottle of wine and boquet of flowers for the room which were lovely and not expensive. We booked a superior room, which was not large but was spotlessly clean and had a balcony facing onto the back of the hotel with a small table and two chairs. I cannot fault the cleanliness of the hotel and the room was spotless when we returned every day. Unfortunately one of the reception staff does not have the best attitude in the world and it always appears that he would rather be somewhere else. However, all the rest of the staff were friendly and helpful and could not do enough to make our stay an enjoyable one. The location is a little further from the centre of town, but the advantage of this is that you can get a great night´s sleep undisturbed. We wakled everywhere from the hotel, even down to the beach and harbour. There are a couple of excellent restaurants within walking distance as well as a bakery/coffee shop on the same road. Overall I cannot recommend it enough and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “meeeh...should have booked elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a distance walk from the nearest metro. Poor, unattentive staff!!! On our arrival to the hotel the receptionist did not acknowledge us that we had just walked in & did not greet us. After checking-in, he said we had to leave our passports because he was busy (there was no one there but us & his computer screen) we said we would wait for it but he said for us to just come back down in 5 mins (what could he not do in 5 mins while we waited downstairs for our passport???), the least he could have done was to tell us he would bring it up to our room when he was done with it. same evening, we asked for a city map of barcelona. a different guy just handed us the map & didnt even tell us where the hotel was located in the map or where the nearest metro was compared to the one we took or where the nearest main attractions were.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!Didn't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: TWH_8
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for two nights with my husband and two teenage kids after our med cruise.found it to be an excellent base,nice comfortable rooms with comfortable beds.great spacious en suite and good air con in rooms.well located,and found staff friendly,mannerly and helpful at all times.would definetely stay in this hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Iain_Barbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Condado at the beginning of July 2010 for a long weekend. The hotel is well located, away from the city centre but easy to get around. The tourist bus stops 5 minutes walk away (ask at reception, they will offer you 2 euro discount per person), and Diagonal Metro station is about 5-10 mins stroll away. We had joining rooms 102 and 103 at the front of the hotel. 2 sets of double glazing in the rooms keeps the street noise at bay, which on a Saturday evening was very noisy due to 2 or 3 local nightclubs. However, although we could hear some noise, it wasn't too much of an issue - after all, it was Saturday in a large city. All other nights we got undisturbed sleep, and sleeping in after 9am was no trouble ! The rooms were well appointed, with really comfortable beds and plenty of space. Breakfast buffet was adequate but nothing special - cereal, yoghurts, fruit, cold meats, sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs - plenty to get the day started. If you are not having breakfast, there are plenty of small bars and cafes in the area. Note - the hotel does not have a restaurant for evening meals, but there are plenty of those around the area. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful when required. There is also free internet on 2 computers in the hotel lobby, and free bottles of water in fridges along the corridors (but get there early if you want them !) Overall I would give the hotel 8 out of 10, but value for money on a budget was excellent compared to some prices that we were quoted for what looked like lower class hotels. If I was going back to Barcelona, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Fossilexpress
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. A bit of a walk to the metro. Avoid the expensive breakfast in the hotel and go to one of the local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location...near attraction but away from noise”
Reviews.Author: Hipo2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just what we needed. It is near Passeig de Gracia and it takes about 15 minutes to get to the Barrio Gótico. It is pretty easy to get to many attractions without being surrounded by noise. The rooms are clean and nice, with a large bathroom. There is free internet connection -make sure to bring your ethernet cable, though. But if you forget it, don´t worry about it , there is free wifi and two computer in the lobby. The staff is helpful and polite. In case you care about those things, there is a supermarket right across the street (I like to have fresh fruit available). There are not a bunch of restaurants around, except a couple of good ones within two minutes but just within 5-10 minutes walk, you can find more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timeortime
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the details were nice and contemporary in style. We liked the location with a great pizza resturant around the corner. We also loved the patisserie across the street. The staff although not overly friendly, we helpful when needed. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: Zsombo
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel. The room was cosy, with a very comfortable bathroom. The room was absolutely silent during the night. The busy city centre is easy to reach. The only thing: it doesn't say on the website that the easiest way to reach the hotel from the airport is to take the Aerobus, get off at Placa Universitate and take bus 64.

Reviews.Title: “Meh, I've had better.”
Reviews.Author: kbcrunk8
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel largely because of the reviews on trip advisor. It seemed that the main complaint was the friendliness, or lack thereof, of the front desk staff so I was slightly prepared. When I went to check in, I was asked for my passport with no explanation, given a key and told to come back down 5-10 minutes later to get my passport. Okay...thanks? I got to my room and tried to turn on the lights which didn't work any where. I finally saw a place for my key as I was on my way back to the lobby. That would have been something helpful to tell me upon check in, no? When I finally got the lights on I saw just how TINY the room was. If all floors are the same layout, it was the x06 room which according to the layout is the smallest room on the floor. There were 2 table lamps and a window that looked in to a "courtyard" that was about 6x6 which meant no sunlight would come in the room. The shower was really poorly lit as well, and by poorly I mean not at all. For some reason my cell phone couldn't find a signal so I was forced to use the room phone to make an international call to the US. I called reception to see if it was possible and to ask how much it would cost. The person who answered offered no help whatsoever. I was told that I could make the call, but he had no idea what it would be. "Maybe 30 cents a minute? I don't know." I asked what they would bill me at check out and again, "I don't know." Not sure how they couldn't know the rates. The night before checkout I requested a taxi be called for me in the morning that accepted Visa. This was arranged without issue but when I got to the airport the ride was $20 more than my trip out to the hotel, which was apparently because I had used a card. I don't fault the hotel for this, but I think it'd be beneficial to at least warn people who ask for a cab that accepts cards that there is a ridiculous surcharge. I would have gladly gone to an ATM had I known. The free wifi in the lobby was good as was the free water and the location wasn't bad, but I was completely unimpressed every where else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Pierre1999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Condado Hotel twice while in Barcelona. It was approximately 15 minutes walk from the more expensive hotels of Las Ramblas, but had many restaurants, bars and places to sit, eat, drink, and people watch. My room each time was a little bit small, but well appointed and very clean. The beds were clean, and very comfortable. For the price I paid I thought Hotel Condado was a good value. The front desk was also friendly. the only negative I might mention is that they state they have breakfast available in their dining room area. I thought (mistakenly) that it was included in the price of the room, but when I checked out there was a 12 Euro charge tacked onto my bill. I did not complain since that's what happens when one assumes, no? So, luckily I only had breakfast there one morning, but it was really not worth the money since there are tons of other breakfast places to grab a coffee and a croissant for far less than 12 Euros. But live and learn!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgoulart
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, good size/ comfortable room, helpful staff in a great neighborhood. There are lots of great restaurants around - we strongly recommend La Tagliatella. The hotel is not so close from the subway Diagonal station - about 10/15 min walking - but this is a nice walking. From this station you can go to almost every touristic attraction in Barcelona. The only attractions in walking distance are La Pedrera and Casa Batló. The hotel offers free mineral water, free internet and 2 computers in the lobby with printer! We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel - there are some great options around the hotel for breakfast and much cheaper. Although the hotel is on a busy street, we didn't hear any noise in our room (first floor). We have a good experience and would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall!”
Reviews.Author: tepidhobbes
Reviews.Content: Rooms were neat and clean. Free wifi in lobby, and free bottles of water were in the fridges in the hallway (although they went fast). Service was very friendly -- allowed us to leave luggage inside their locked office when we arrived very early in the morning, and also allowed us to check in early. Overall a very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Modern Hotel in Upscale District - just make sure you know pros and cons of location”
Reviews.Author: uclarobin
Reviews.Content: Condado Hotel is a small upscale boutique hotel in Barcelona's L'Eixample District. If you haven't been to Barcelona, you should know that L'Eixample is the original upscale "suburb" (100 years ago) of the main center of Barcelona - not exactly near where all the tourist attractions and tourist shops are crammed together. In terms of location: you have a great advantage of being away from all the touristy postcard/trinket stops that most Barcelona visitors wade through. You are experiencing a much more real Barcelona than those staying at one of the zillion hotels near Las Ramblas. This neighborhood is very trendy and upscale, with so many cute, lovely boutique shops (again, for natives, not tourists). If you are a window shopper, you are in heaven! The streets are wide with generous sidewalks and bike paths. If I could afford to live in this L'Eixample District, I would do it in heartbeat. We loved that it was nice and safe at night. We loved that we ate coffee and pastry for breakfast with all Spaniards, not tourists. However, the downside is that you are a 15-minute walk from the nearest metro stop (Diagonal). However, you can easily catch a bus down to Las Ramblas - no worries. There is also a direct bus to Parc Guell. Also, in this upscale neighborhood, the restaurants are pricey: pricey in a quality-restaurant way, not in an overpriced-rip-off-tourists way. As for the hotel decor, the lobby is minimalist, modern and elegant, with rich woods and plush sofas. Same with the rooms: crisp white bed, cappuccino wood furniture and floors - all in a very elegant modern style. Two adults with two big suitcases fit in just fine. Bonus #1: The hotel provides unlimited cold bottled water for guests. Bonus #2: The hotel has one computer with internet and a printer for use in the lobby. I never had to wait to use it. Downside #1: The hotel's laundry is ridiculously overpriced! For example: 4E for one undergarment. When I asked the front desk for an alternate Laundromat nearby, I was disappointed to learn that they could not direct me to one. They told me any other wash& fold service nearby would be just as expensive. So, I took a 6E cab ride to another neighborhood where I learned of a cheap self-service Laundromat. Downside #2: The hotel's buffet breakfast looked nice, but no way am I paying 12E for my breakfast, when there is a diverse assortment of coffee shops across the street.

Reviews.Title: “All as expected.... Just Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellexer
Reviews.Content: Hotel was exactly as described, staff very helpful Am happy we choose this Hotel, would advise other to do so TOO!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, but not central”
Reviews.Author: lemkinn
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, and great value for Barcelona. We were a fair bit out of the centre, but we knew that when we booked. The walk into the centre is pleasant with some great little places to eat and drink on the way. We would stay there again. A nice little touch was that they offered free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, large, clean rooms and helpful staff - loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: tobyo99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of a two week trip in Spain. Although the hotel was far from the main sights, it was perfect for us as we preferred to stay off the beaten path. We were also aware that it was a bit of a walk to the metro station, which was not a problem as it's a very pleasant walk with shops and places to eat along the way. On our last day, we opted to take a taxi back to the hotel as we were rather tired and didn't want to take that walk back from Diagonal metro station. The room and bathroom were clean and very large in comparison to the other hotels we stayed throughout our trip. We had free wifi in our room which I was not aware of so that was a pleasant surprise. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I'm in Barcelona again, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in quiet, out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: ReyNardG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early May. The room was good sized with a large bathroom (largest we had on a 16 day trip). The hotel in general and the room in particular were very clean. There was free bottled water outside the room (pick early) and a small safe for valuables in a closet in the room. Quiet with no noise from street or adjacent rooms. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and spoke good English. It is a moderate walk (1 kilometer) to the Diagonal metro station. Coffee shops are very close for a light breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: melemelon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the "deluxe" room with terrace. The staff was very helpful & friendly and spoke excellent english. The location was a little far from the Barri Gotic, but it was close to many trendy restaurants & cafes in the Eixample. We found that the combination of walking, the tourist bus & occassional taxi got us everywhere we wanted to go. Our room was in the back of the hotel and was very quiet. The busy street life at the front did not bother us at all. We chose the location at the suggestions of Barcelona residents who described it as one of the safest neighborhoods in the city. The rate was very reasonable and included breakfast in a city that has some stratospheric hotel rates!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & charming Hotel in the best area of central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveller7791
Reviews.Content: What a surprise!!! This charming hotel is in an upmarket area of central Barcelona. Free Internet & bottled water are a good bonus!!! Comprenhensive American Breakfast was included in the package :-) I would suggest the hotel management to put an additional computer in the lobby -foc too-. One is not enough sometimes. Great nearby restaurant suggestions (Cross offers delicious Tapas & Santiagino amzing seafood). The neighbourhood is a safe & elegant area plenty of local Bars, shops, boutiques and not really far from Passeig de Gracia (metro station) Within walking distance. Avoid metro to reach Las Ramblas area. use bus 58.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL.. JUST A LITTLE FAR FROM THE MAIN CENTER”
Reviews.Author: FRANKLEONE
Reviews.Content: I stayed only 1 night and everything was cool.. the only problem is that is not at walking distance from the main attractions.. The rooms are nice with a minimal decor.. I had a very silent toom but the view was towards a wall!.. Anyway... I suggest it for a good stay in Barcellona with good quality and price..

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way, but very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexanderphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010, our last night in Barcelona. Most of the major sights people go to Barcelona to see are not near this hotel, but Barcelona is a great city to walk in. The front desk staff was friendly, professinal, and helpful. The room was comfortable, with a small patio attached.

Reviews.Title: “Simple But Good”
Reviews.Author: ArchieLeach
Reviews.Content: This is a simple hotel- both in its minimalist decor and its facilities. There's no restaurant, bar or even mini bar though they do provide breakfast and you can get drinks. However its staff are friendly and helpful and the room was quiet and comfortable. We had a view across low roofs at the back of the hotel in room 209. Our friends were less fortunate with a view of a wall (and consequently not much natural light) in room 201. It was good value. It's in a working district so the you have to travel a bit for the sights and it's a little distance from the Metro. There are some nice restaurants close by with a very local feel- La Sangiovesa and the Monchos tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not cheap & odd service.”
Reviews.Author: Hooemi
Reviews.Content: I decided not to deal with the madness & price of the more tourist-friendly areas like Las Ramblas & Barri Gòtic so I stayed here in the more business / shopping district. The hotel itself was very nice, very clean & very quiet. They have one single computer in the lobby & free wi-fi there but not in the rooms. It was a little pricey for the location but not bad & quite comfortable. It's a little far from the metro but only a 7 - 9 Euro cab ride from the tourist hubs. The problem was the people at the desk- I got very odd answers to any questions I asked pertaining to anything except the hotel itself. It got to be a running joke with my friend & me, to the point that we realized that they were either unwilling or unable to offer any advice on anything outside the hotel walls.

Reviews.Title: “loved Barcelona and Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simon2458
Reviews.Content: Not much in the way of facilities but then we didnt expect any but free bottled water was appreciated. Would have been nice to have a beer or glass of wine in their lounge area. The hotel was very clean and the room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. The staff were also very helpful especially as they were dealing with the Volcanic flight caos. The breakfast was also very good and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Supportive Staff”
Reviews.Author: pbffosterq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado Hotel both at the beginning and at the end of our trip. The Hotel was terrific, and the staff was first rate. They supported every aspect of planning our exploration of Barcelona, from advising of correct bus and metro routes, to making calls to see whether museums and restaurants were open and making reservations. The rooms were of excellent quality and absolutely spotless. The only downside to the hotel is that it is at least a good ten minute walk to the nearest metro stop and it is not close to most of Barcelona's best restaurants and museums. This makes it a little less convenient, but not enough to discourage a wonderful endorsement of the hotel. i would stay there again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: EBEBIsrael
Reviews.Content: Big rooms. Very clean. Helpfull friendly staff. Good breakfast. Very good value for price. Nice neighbourhood

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Kamakamilia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very good value for your money. Clean, well kept room. Very good service from reception when needen help for a day out of Barcelona. Hotel is little walk from metro, but bus from city centre stops right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rosecaresse
Reviews.Content: we stayed in barcelona for a city break at hotel Condado. I must say we had warm and quick check in by efficient staff at 12 midnight. they were helpful and friendly. hotel was nice, room was clean and cozy with good climate control. it had a safe and free high speed wifi which did not work in upper floors but we could use in cozy lobby. it is short walk from ave diagnol and few steps away from a bus stop. it was better than few 4 star hotels i have stayed in and i will recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: sparkybuente
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our two recent visits to the Hotel Condado. It is a great boutique hotel, wonderful service and location. Staff is excellent, rooms nicely appointed and a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiselaW
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my children in a family room, which means two rooms connected. You can close a door to the rest of the hotel and keep close contact with your children without having to sleep in the same room. We spent five nights there, my children loved having their own room with own bathroom and TV. We travelled around with buses and metro, very good location. I strongly reccommend this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ali_gh
Reviews.Content: Hello, Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for a few nights and it was very good. Good location in a good area of Barcelona,was quite and relaxing.Very confortable after a long day visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet Eixample hotel”
Reviews.Author: victor19nyc
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room at this hotel, plenty of space for two adults and a child. The room was very clean with plenty of shelves to store items for our 5 night stay. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The only downside to the room, and a very minor one at that, was the fact that the outdoor patio faced inward to the city block so the view was the backside of other surrounding apartment buildings. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, but we picked this hotel because a lot of other hotel reviews mentioned noise, especially at night (seeing the locations first hand made it easy to see why). It was very quiet at Condado. Don't be put off by the location. The nearest subway station at Diagonal is only a 10 minute walk away, and the Gracia FGC stop (L6, L7) was a couple blocks closer. Also the bus service was excellent. The 58 stops in front of the hotel and goes directly to Placa de Catalunya, and you can also get there by catching the 7 along Diagonal. The 27 bus from Diagonal can easily take you to Placa de Espanya (note: the 58 does not run on Sundays). There is no restaurant at the hotel but there is a dining room where breakfast is served daily from 7:00am to 11:00am (we did not have the breakfast so we cannot review). Bottled water is readily available on each floor and the staff can provide drinks and snacks in the lobby in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: tudin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as expected, only downside were the noisy guests passing our room in the early hours and people above moving furniture. The desk staff were very efficient and polite. Most of the time I did not have to quote my room number, they had our key ready for us and on check out the desk manager asked how we were getting to the hotel and called a taxi for us. I would recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: torry_holt_88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in November for 4 days and loved this hotel. Our room was in excellent condition, with all of the amenities of any top hotel. It was clean, quiet, and much larger than I expected. There is a minibar on each floor with drinks that you are free to have and there is a computer in the lobby with free internet access. Location-wise, it is close to a bus turistic stop (both red and blue lines), but is a bit far from the closest subway stop (Diagonal). We walk pretty fast and it was still about a 15 minute trek to the subway. However, it is still definitely walkable. It is also about a 20 minute walk to Casa Mila and the block of discord. There is a supermarket just across the street and many restaurants and shops in close by. The staff was also very knowledgable. We were also able to buy discounted bus turistic tickets at the front desk. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ANCStaffs
Reviews.Content: Had a really good stay, traveled with my wife and a 20 month daughter. We had a triple room which had a cot put in free of charge. The room was well clean and spacious with a lovely balcony, there was no view as we were at the back but it was safe for Eva to wander around on. It's about a 10 min walk to Placa Catalunya through shops and bars, parking is easy and just opposite (make sure you ask the carpark for a discount we had 10 Euros knocked of the bill.. 25Euro for 24 hours).. All in all would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this deal!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyOH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Condado for three nights at the end of November. The rooms and common areas were spotless and hip. Our room faced front and had a large balcony area. We were concerned because we were also across from the elevator. Surprisingly there was absolutely no noise. The staff at the front desk were top notch - always seemed to be two on duty. Helped us immensely with any questions we had on dining, metro, etc. Did take advantage of the breakfast which was part of our package. It's a basic buffet and definitely worth it if you want the convenience. Just be aware that you will have a short walk to use the metro to get downtown, which is excellent once you figure it out. Also loved the free use of computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired from a long trip and were checked in immediately. The room was ready and in excellent shape with all the simple amenities we needed: a bed, pillows and curtains to darken the room. Aaaahhh! it was wonderful. The room had adequate storage and while compact it was comfortable. The bathroom was fine and the sink was in the room so two people could be getting ready at the same time. Very practical. Oh, and did I say it was stylish with a black, gray and white decor. The location was very practical while out of the touristy route. A block away was a good bakery where we breakfasted most days, but the hotel also had an excellent, if pricey breakfast. What was excellent about the location was that it was a comfortable walk to the northern end of the Rambla, just a block or two farther to one of Gaudi's apartment/museums. A bus stopped on the street by the hotel coming up from the old town/harbor area which we caught around the block from the hotel going the other way. I thought the buses were better than the subway because (a) they went more places, and (b) there weren't so many pick pockets. (My partner got his wallet picked in the sub way but we made them give it back. All was well that ended well.) The men at the desk of the hotel were very helpful in guiding us to use the transportation system and also giving excellent restaurant recommendations. Eight to ten blocks away were many many restaurants on or near the Rambla. We ate in a number of different places with Tapas and didn't really have a bad meal, thanks to the guidance of our hotel. So, in a word or two, this was an excellent hotel with a decent price and in a safe, bustling, business neighborhood. You couldn't go wrong with Hotel Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Not in downtown but good value”
Reviews.Author: SakhalinGirl
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review. This hotel is not located in the center of Barcelona (on the same token, not in a very center remote location), but easy accessable by bus, and about 15-20 mins walk from the nearest metro station. Many various restaurants and cafes around. The Diagonal Street shops are almost round the corner, in fact, all major middle class brands you can find within 10-15 mins walk. Very clean rooms and helpful staff. Furniture seems to be new. Minimalism in style but nice and comfortable. Buffet breakfast was nice. The choice was not luxurious but decent and quality was good. If you are looking for a compromise between central location/good service/how clean and comfortable rooms are/ and price, this hotel will be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: RoamingRobin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condado is located in the north of the city but is easily accessible by public transport. We had a good size room on the 7th floor which was decorated in a mininalist style. Whole hotel was done in cool modern tones without being overly trendy. Clean and serviced daily and a large bathroom. Front desk was helpful. Recommended Monchos around the corner which had a very extensive buffet in the evening. Only glitch was a rather grumpy breakfast server on our final day, but range of breakfast was good. There is a sandwich shop close to the hotel we used on the other days. Had no bad experiences in Barcelona over our 5 day trip and we went to most of the main sights and used public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Condado is pleasant and clean, in a nice area and has highly competent staff”
Reviews.Author: grantip
Reviews.Content: Four of us in two rooms stayed four nights and felt secure and comfortable. The hotel has up-to-date rooms and facilities. When I experienced a dental emergency the competent and helpful staff, most of whom speak English well, located a nearby dentist, made the appointment, told us how to get to the dental clinic. They were always willing to answer any questions and offer assistance. A big plus: we were able to access the Internet, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, spotless hotel, friendly staff, good value, nice area.”
Reviews.Author: Henna3
Reviews.Content: Echo every great review of this hotel. Very clean and comfortable hotel. We only had one minor discomfort. The night clerk was a very friendly young man willing to help in any way. When we mentioned we were going to the Music Museum the next day, he offered a discount coupon but we told him we had 2 discount coupons, not knowing we had lost one. The next morning we asked the gentlemen at the desk if he could give us the discount coupon but he said they didn't have any. I explained the night clerk had offered us one, but he again said no and didn't even search. We did not understand this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location for Business”
Reviews.Author: MrCleanWisconsin
Reviews.Content: + Good value, clean, quiet, responsive staff, good breakfast, good location for my business needs, free mini-bar (water and soda) a nice touch. - Design of the bathroom roomy but not comforable This is the third hotel I have stayed at in the area. For the rate and location I reccomend it. Ask for a room with a balcony facing the courtyard in back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Barcelon”
Reviews.Author: mcanter
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this small hotel. It was recently updated, so the room was clean and very functional. The service was terrific. My only complaints relate to the noise level from outside (which is true of any hotel in Barcelona), and it was a long walk to the centeral piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Would recomment - but good distance from town”
Reviews.Author: SonicIrish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Condado for 5 nights - the hotel is spotless and the staff are very helpful. The only thing I found was it was a bit far out of town. We preferred going to the port every evening - and this cost abotu 10 euro each way in a taxi. But if you are not pushed on location - I would highly recommend this hotel and it was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Expectations--Great Staff, Good Value, Clean!”
Reviews.Author: girlloml
Reviews.Content: We echo the positive reviews from other guests. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and resourceful. Because it's small the attention is very personal. We were pleasantly suprised by the complimentary soda and water on each floor. The accommodations were extremely clean and attractive and we found the location just fine, especially for people who like to walk, like us. (We did spent 2 nights in a more central location later in our stay.) It's really a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, modern, and good value”
Reviews.Author: Alkileu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days. The room is very nice, modern, clean and we had a balcony with outdoor seating. We could watch the festival fireworks from our bed! Location was near all the Gaudi stuff and lots of nice restaurants within walking distance. There was fast internet access on the PC in the lobby. Staff was friendly and spoke English. Barcelona was a highlight of our 3 week trip to Iberia. Thanks Condado Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel witha Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeasonTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: The Condado has an excellent staff. Rooms are a bit small, but very comfortable. The Hotel is about a 30 minute walk to major attractions and has several very good restaurants within a ten minute walk. Great free mini bar on each floor with water, soda and beer! The Condado is well worth the price, especially since it provides free internet and a safe. Book on Hotels.com and get a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, modern, spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: AngCIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado for 2 nights on the 18th and 19th of September. We found it to be modern and very clean. We were very impressed by the excellent air conditioning and the free mini bar is a nice touch especially when like us you arrive late at night when all the shops are closed. The buffet breakfast had a good range of food but we found the waiter to be quite surly and not very helpful. Other than that the front desk staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant. Our bedroom was large with plenty of room for a cot for our baby and the heavy curtains were very useful for blocking out the light in the morning and encouraging the little one to stay asleep. It was also extremely quiet. The front desk receptionist recommended a restaurant around the corner, the name of which escapes me, which did a huge buffet dinner on the Saturday night. It was great value with lots of seafood. I'd have no hesitation in going back to the Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find with the Condado”
Reviews.Author: amkkc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with Condado and couldn't have been more pleased. It was an excellent value (found great fare on Hotels.com) and was upgraded to a room with an awesome balcony. The location was also great as it was not in the touristy part but was very easy to get to all areas of the city. And there are lots of cafes close, including a grocery store that is right across the street. The shower was massive and the free drinks in the mini fridges on each floor was really nice. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Todo muy bien”
Reviews.Author: omarpduvall
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Condado, twice--the first time for one night and then for two nights a couple of weeks later. I searched HARD to find a hotel in BCN in this price range (85 euros w/o breakfast) and at this level of quality. I found virtually everything about the hotel to be great. Our rooms were spotless and very quiet. In both cases, we had a small terrace which was wonderful to have. We even left the door open at night and the street sounds were only a murmur of white noise. The showers are great. One of our stays, we even had a bathtub. The beds are comfortably solid. There are safes in each room. The neighborhood is fine for walking at night. There are restaurants nearby for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The personnel were entirely pleasant and helpful. The lads we encountered at the desk are perhaps a bit serious but plenty helpful. They helped us with restaurants, taxis, museums, and buses. We communicated entirely in castellano, though we heard other guests using English with staff at the main desk. One complaint voiced often in comments is that the hotel is far from the metro. The desk staff can help you with buses, taxis, trains, and metro. For example, we took a bus from Diagonal (about a two block walk) directly to Plaza Espanya in order to go to the Museo Nacional de Arte de Catalunya. Another possibility is the ferrocarril, which connects to the metro and stops nearer to the hotel. The easiest walk FROM the metro is the Fontana stop. It is downhill to the hotel and a nice walk. The easiest walk TO the metro is the Diagonal stop, also a nice walk. Another option is the Bus Turistic. You can get a pass for one day (21 euros) or two days (27 euros) and you can hop on and off. There are 3 routes with 6 transfer points, one of which is pretty near the hotel at Plaza Francesc Macia. This bus might be an option if you want to see sights as well as get transported around the city. Another frequent complaint in comments is the cost of the breakfast. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. We ate at a nearby panaderia called Bopan, on Travessera de Gracia within 3 blocks of the hotel. Great coffee, bocadillos de jamon, tortilla de patata, and croissant. Total for two of us was under 15 euros. There is a great lunch restaurant nearby as well, La Llesca. It serves traditional Catalan cuisine. You can order a la carte. Be aware that the restaurant allows smoking (some don't--BIG change from even 5 years ago). I find the food and ambiance worth it. Hotel Condado has a free minibar on each floor and in the lobby where you can get bottles of water, coke, or non-alcoholic beer. This was a real plus. I highly recommend this hotel. I seriously doubt you can do better for price to value and still be near the center of BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent staff in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: Minichuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and easy to find as it's so close to one of the main roads that runs through Barcelona. We were greeted by the most friendly and helpful staff and then went to our room. It was roomy and had loads of storage space. The only negative was that the road was a little noisy on a Friday/Saturday night with the traffic but only slightly, it really didn't bother us at all. Thumbs up! :D

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MartaLP
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time there! The room we got was spacious, kept in a nice style (fashinable fabricks and colours) and very very clean! We had our own bathroom (tiled floor to ceiling, nicely arranged), wardrobe and a balcony with 2 chairs and a table. The safe-box was in our room but the fridge/mini bar (included in price) was in the hall on each floor. Computer/internet access in the lobby on ground floor. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and chatty :) we could ask them anything: where to go, how to get somewhere, what's the weather like for the next day - anything really and they would always keep us well informed. Hotel is located about 20 minutes walk from the city centre, 10 minutes from metro station and 5 minutes from nearest bus stop. We are so happy with the service in Hotel Condado we would definately stay there again while visitng Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “thanks for your services”
Reviews.Author: azzam_loay
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are extremely helpful and pointed us in all the right directions for buses, the metro... The hotel lobby & rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again in a second.”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelers_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything others have claimed on TripAdvisor. The hotel was very neat/clean and stylish, the staff helpful even though we do not speak Spanish, they lent me a network cable to use the free internet in our room when I only had wireless and lent my husband a corkscrew to open the wine he purchased at the grocery store next door. The free water and coke in the mini bar was very useful and adds to the value of the hotel. Breakfast was great, service was friendly and efficient. I enjoyed the location very close to the avenue diagonal. It was extremely convenient to the bus turistic and plenty of places to eat in the evening. The only very minor drawbacks, depending on what is important to your stay, is that the view out our room was of a wall of the building behind us about 15 feet away. This did not bother us in any way. Also, the location is not central but cab rides were not expensive to the Barri Gothic and it is a very short walk to the bus turistic. We would be fortunate to stay here again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We will recommend this hotel to our family and friends”
Reviews.Author: AndraBrasov
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband 8 nights at the Condado Hotel in the august. I was very pleased of their cleanliness, which is very important to me. The personell was kind and carring. I enjoy the breakfast, which I found it very good. The price is fair and I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wisdom_of_others
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condado stands out for its great service and tastefully designed rooms, fitting for a stylish city like Barcelona. The guys at reception were very friendly and had an answer for any question a traveller might ask, and if they didn't know, they made an effort to find out. Internet and minibar was free. The hotel is centrally located and is close to restaurants, cafes and public transport. Unfortunately the hotel hasn't got a parking space and we had to go to a privately operated underground carpark nearby. It is a bit of a walk, but possible to take a stroll down to Las Ramblas. We caught a taxi on the way back though. We had a great time in Barcelona and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Condado very much. Would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel but a little far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: john_bishop1
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are extremely helpful and pointed us in all the right directions for buses, the metro and more. The hotel lobby is spacious and very clean. There is a computer available to use but it was nearly always in use. However, there didn't tend to be a queue for it so only had to wait five minutes. We had to family rooms - two rooms joined through a small connection. The rooms are very clean and tidy and neatly laid out. They are a bit on the small side however, and a mirror in the room would have been a good idea. It was great to have two rooms for the family. The free mini-bar is a fantastic idea but it does clear out fairly quickly. If you want water I would recommend getting it in the evening as there is not chance of getting it in the morning! My main complaint about the rooms was the door - not the actual door to the rooms but the door to the small corridor you needed to get into to get to the rooms. The lock was a real nuisance. We struggled to open it, it didn't work! Eventually, we opened it. This happened on every occasion we wanted to get into the rooms. As you can imagine, we were very tired after a hard day sightseeing and just wanted to get in! This was really annoying and my main complaint. The hotel is situated a good half an hour away from La Rambla (centre) and, although this walk was pleasant as first, it did become a bit of a trek! I would recommend somewhere closer to the centre as there are more restaurants there and it is more lively. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel (as recommended by other reviewers) and instead went to this fantastic patisserie just down the road. It is called elFornet (turn right outside the hotel, walk 100 yards and cross the road). The food is very reasonably priced and tasty. A Starbucks is also found around the corner. In La Rambla, we went to a great restaurant called The Attic which served fantastic food. Highly recommended. I would recommend getting the bus for travelling around the city. Just ask at reception in the hotel for which bus you need to take to get anywhere. They are very knowledgeable and save you the hassle of muddling through tourist guides. Overall, the hotel is good value and the staff are fantastic. It is a bit far from the centre but if you take the bus, this will probably be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leedswanderlust
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in quieter area of the city. Good deal booking on internet, on hotels own website. Included breakfast. Not the best hotel breakfast we'd ever had but perfectly adequate. Clean comfortable rooms. Friendly service. Very accomodating when we asked to leave suitcases for a couple of hours. Would definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, refined, and comfortable retreat in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LMctrip
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, with spotless, elegant rooms that are minimal in decor but extremely comfortable and serene. Shower was terrific, as were the beds and crisp linens. Loved the free beverages in the lobby and on our floor. The breakfast was a true highlight with fresh hot foots (i.e. fresh eggs and sausages) and fresh fruit, breads, cheeses, meats...all served in a bright, welcoming room. Our room had a terrific balcony facing the courtyard. It was a true joy to return here after a long day. It also offers good access to the sights and is a short walk to the subway. The front reception staff was very professional and the servers in the restaurant, also terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: gutierrez2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, when we walked in... i was like... holy s***, you cant get a better price for a hotel like this. The staff was super helpful, room was very clean and spacious. The complimentary water & soft drinks was a big plus. You can take a 10 minute walk to the metro or just catch a bus right in front of it. I loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: leone2107
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night break at the Hotel Condado and this is a hotel not to be missed! Although it is a good 25 minute walk from the main bit of Las Ramblas this meant that the area was not as busy but had plenty eating places very close by and had a more Spanish atmosphere. The main hotel reception area is very well kept with free internet access and plenty of nice comfy chairs. The rooms are spacious, modern and very clean with lovely bathoooms. Each floor has fridges with soft drinks and bottled water for free (but you have to be up quite early to get these as they disappear very quickly!) Breakfast was very good with a wide range of food - hot or cold and plenty tea/coffee and juice and rolls/pastries. All in all we had a lovely break here and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and hope to go back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasesPacked
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel mid July.
