Plus: +clean rooms +helpful staff - we were in town for the Tour de France & the staff were able to help us find easy ways to view the race that were away from the big crowds. +free cokes & water on each floor & in the lobby. + air-conditioning +free wifi in the lobby +room we had was quiet +small terrace. +nice little coffee shop steps away from hotel you can use for breakfast if you don't use the hotel breakfast option. Other points to know - not necessarily a + or - - bed were firm. - rooms were a bit small but for the price thought it was fine and on par with many smaller European hotels. - 10-15 minute walk to the subway station Diagnal (whiich is a fairly major location and has two lines) - there are also buses that pick up 2 blocks from the hotel and it is on the route for the tourist double decker bus (if you get one of those passes - not exactly sure where that picks up but we saw it going buy frequently) -15 minute walk to Gaudi's Casa Mila - classic queen size bed for europe being 2 twins joined together - but there was less of a transition between the two - hard to detect the split. Not so good.. - view from terrace was of building tops not all that appealing but didn't spend much time in the room. One note in general about Barcelona - watch your wallet. Had 3 incidents in 4 days with attempted pick pockets. But Barcelona is a really nice city - just need to be really careful. Also found this web site really helpful on figuring out neighborhoods http://www.barcelona-tourist-guide.com/faq/questions/152/Which-Barcelona-Area-to-Stay-In%3F

Reviews.Title: “#1 Hotel stay for our trip, staff questionable”
Reviews.Author: swtdreamer84
Reviews.Content: We had two connecting rooms for our family suite. Excellent value as there were two bathrooms, and the room was very comfortable and modern. Also, as many noted, love the free drinks, although you must make sure to wake up early enough to get the water, as they don't restock quite often enough. Two drawbacks are #1, it is 10 minutes from metro, probably uphill (depending on which metro you get off of). #2, the restaurant recommendation by the staff was not good at all. The place was way overpriced and virtually empty. The food was just okay. So if you do your own restaurant research and don't mind walking, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “A great value out of the touristy areas...”
Reviews.Author: SarahMar
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Condado for 3 nights in mid-July. We chose the hotel based on trip advisor reviews and a good deal found through a booking site. Our room was small, but very clean and did not have that bare/sterile feel that I've experienced in a lot of other budget hotels. The shower was surprisingly large and a real treat after spending all day on our feet in the heat. I did think it was a little weird that the door separating the toilet from the rest of the room was only a swinging piece of frosted glass that didn't actually close. The complimentary drinks were awesome. They could have been better stocked, but we could usually find what we needed by going to another floor. The staff were courteous and we had no trouble communicating. There is a supermarket directly across the street which we found very convenient. We did not pay for breakfast and found it very easy to grab breakfast within a block or two of the hotel at one of the numerous bakery-type places. We liked Bopan the best on Travessera de Gracia, about a block away. The free internet access in the lobby was very convenient, but consistently in use, so we did have to wait each time we needed it. If you think you will need to use the internet often, it would be better to have your own computer and use free internet in your room. We loved the location. We actually did walk once from the hotel all the way to the water just to look around, but I would recommend public transport for most of your comings and goings. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at Condado”
Reviews.Author: cavfilr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the condado July 3,4, while awaiting a Med cruise. Hotel is located close to the "Diagonal", and a not too long walk from it seemed, anywhere. Staff is very helpful with storage of your luggage as most flights from the US seem to get in in the am. No conscierge, but the pretty English fluent staff were most helpful in suggesting restaurants, public transport, etc. There is a supermarket across the street next to the loud disco which opens up a 11 pm. We had a family suite, which you may now know, is two rooms connected by a lockable common hallway. It was very convenient for the 4 of us (wife and 2 teen girls). Two baths and comfortable beds. Hotel walls are,,, a little thin as the first night we were entitled to some "sounds of private entertainment" in the next room...@ 1 am,rather loud. No internet in the room, but free in the lobby. the comp. sodas and bottle water were in the common hallway by the elevator, and unfortunately were not stocked as well as they could have been. By 9:00 all the water was taken, It seems some travelers want to stock up on their way out. All in all the hotel was very nice, comfortable, cool (Barcelona was hot that week). Did not try the breakfast, 12 eur. per person was steep. Nice coffee shops down the street cheaper. Also, Starbucks. Did not ride the subway, but the Bus Tourist was 4 blocks south and gives you a nice "drive around" feel, but at 21 euros. for the day. On and off priveleges a the stops. Highly recommend for moderate upscale tourism hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Just two thoughts to bear in mind.”
Reviews.Author: needmyholidays71
Reviews.Content: Really a very nice and good value hotel. We got a good deal on their internet site that included breakfast, which was nice. The rooms were very clean and modern with a free soft-drinks minibar and free internet access in the lobby. One drawback is that it's a bit of a walk to Las Ramblas, and about ten minutes walk to the metro. One warning too, on our last night we asked at reception for a restaurant reccomendation, somewhere nice nearby for Catalan/Spanish food. We were reccommended "Cros Diagonal" which although nearby, was a really terrible restaurant (both its food and service) we didn't hang around for dessert or coffee. Knowing these two things we would reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really really..really good!”
Reviews.Author: Star1405
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a hen party (classy girls may I add!) there were 8 of us and I booked x2 family rooms which had a private lobby and front door which was a nice touch and sociable for groups. The hotel is really lovely, modern and clean. Rooms were a great size, bathroom was floor to ceiling marble and again, immaculately clean. The hotel offers a free mini bar on each floor - this consists of a 2 fridges that contain bottles or water, coke and non alcoholic cider - this was wonderful, how many hotels offer a perk like that? Now on to the best bit.. the service. I couldnt have asked for friendlier or a more helpful front desk - 3 gentleman whos names I have forgotton - sorry. I think they were slightly alarmed when 8 girls walked in! but dealt with everything very well - helped with directions, maps, extra towels that were needed and one of the girls locked herself out of her rooms at least 4 times over the weekend but was always greeted with a smile when one of them came up to the 5th floor to let her in. We also asked for a late check out on the sunday which they were very obliging in doing. The location of the hotel is great too - bus 54 which is round the corner takes you straight to placa catalunya in 15 minuted and taxis a plently are constantly available outside the hotel. All in all a perfect stay at this hotel - Tripadvisor is my BIBLE which is how I came across this hotel in the first place - the hotel ranking is high but the price is surprisingly low! None of us were disappointed in the choice - thank you for making our stay so enjoyable and we will definitely see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Condado”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateTourist
Reviews.Content: Had a superior room with a terrace on the 3rd floor. Very nice, quiet, comfortable room. AC worked perfectly, which was a blessing since it was so hot during our stay. The hotel is in a good location, near the subway and lots of restaurants. Hotel staff was helpful. The breakfast buffet was good. There was a PC and printer in the lobby for guest use. Very convenient for checking in and printing boarding passes for our return flight to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: rayk2099
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, free mini bar is a great idea (we wen through many chilled botles of water in the July heat) and everything worked as advertised For me the only issue was the location, being a 20 minute walk away from the main parts of the city. However there was plenty of stuff going on around the hotel, so the location may not be an issue for everyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with a few small concerns”
Reviews.Author: Sturbridge
Reviews.Content: The service, cleanliness, helpfulness of the personnel, and the general quiet of the rooms as well as their size and appearance were all exemplary. The wi-fi worked fine, but having only one public computer station for all guests is not enough. The breakfasts were expensive and ordinary (three of us ate breakfasts nearby for the cost of what they charge for one at the hotel). Their unlimited free soda and water were very welcome, and a generous and thoughtful provision of the hotel. One of our party found the pillows uncomfortable, but that may be a cultural matter. Location - in the overall terms of the wonderful city of Barcelona is excellent - but if you plan to use the very fine metro and find walking a challenge (we don't), the hotel is midway between two rather widely spaced stations. We had a delightful visit and the staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wien
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at this hotel was excellent.Rooms were clean staff very helpful.Position of hotel was a short walk to Metro or twenty minute walk to tourist sights.My only comment was the behaviour of some guests whose drunken behaviour in throwing half empty beercans against walls and doors etc in the early hours was a disappointment, maybe there is no need by the hotel to supply complimentary supplies of beer that are situated in each hallway fridge.The mess that the staff had to clean up during my stay was apalling.eg.overturned fridges , pools of beer etc. Overall however I would certainly recommend this hotel to any visitor to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: metapieman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Condado for a week long holiday with my girlfriend. We were very satisfied with it and would definitely stay there again. The service in particular was excellent. For example, when we checked in it was late (11pm), and we asked whether there were any restaurants nearby that would still be open. The man at the desk called a nearby restaurant, asked if they could seat us, and made a reservation - we went and the food was excellent. The lounge area is very nicely decorated and there is a computer for free internet access. The hotel is located in an attractive area that felt safe. It is near an upmarket shopping area where two famous Gaudi buildings are located, but is not right in the centre of town. Getting to the nearest subway station is a longish walk (15 minutes or so), but there are city buses that pass much closer to the hotel and take you right into the centre, which we found to be more convenient. We only had one problem, which was that the room we were in for the first couple of nights had very little natural light, so in the mornings it was quite dark. However, we asked if we could change rooms and we were moved to a different one overlooking the street, which was much lighter. Both the rooms we stayed in were nicely decorated in a modern style, and were very clean. They each contained a safe, which we found very convenient for storing passports and valuables.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: ADRIAN888
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel and I we were extremely happy with our choice. The hotel is in a region called Gracia which is 15 mins walk from Ramblas and the area has a nice atmosphere with some good eating options and great shops. We got a great deal through hotels.com and at £67 a night it was a bargain. The hotel itself is clean, modern and well run with extremely helpful reception staff. A nice touch was the free water & fizzy drinks in coolers on each floor. There is a great place for pastries and snacks nearby. It is called D'en Rossend elFornet. If you turn right out of the hotel door and walk down the hill about 150yds it is on the opposite side of the road. There is also a supermarket directly opposite the hotel entrance. Also a 10 min walk will take you to a fantastic little Thai restaurant called Petite Bangkok. It isn't flash but the food is out of this world and its cheap, but do get there between 8.30 and 9 or you will sruggle to get a table. All in all we had a great stay and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: i_am_pete
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, the reception staff were polite and helpful but professional too. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. I did book a twin room and ended up with a 3/4 bed in a small room but it was fine. My friend booked the same but was more specific about what he wanted so you can ask for a balcony or larger room. There is a free mini bar in the corridor of each floor (but soft drinks only).

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in a fairly convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: topcat58
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff. Staff was very helpful in directing us I our touring and sightseeing while visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: reneva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condado June 3-6/09. The service was excellent and we were very well taken care of. The room was very clean and comfortable and was furnished in a cosmopolitan style. The breakfast was great --not too big not too small but just enough selection of hot, cold and fresh juices and fruit. Every morning we had room service bring us coffee and it was fast and friendly service. The free email desk in the lobby was so nice to be able to use. A definite plus when you don't travel with your own computer. It was quiet and comfortable. The self serve bar was such a great feature as well. It was nice to have all the water (and pop if you drink that) that you needed. In a city like Barcelona, which I found quite overwelming, I felt very safe here. The front desk made reservations for us at a wonderful restaurant and we had two very enjoyable delicious meals there. It was within easy walking distance to the Hop on, Hop off Tourist Bus stop and the front desk provided us with discount coupons for this. It was a good central location and not too close to La Ramlas. If we stayed again I might ask for a room with a better view as we stayed in room 111 which was great but no light came in. However, we were never in our room during the day anyhow. Great job and thank you!

Reviews.Title: “well run hotel in great location ideal for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: denis220262
Reviews.Content: arrived late for three nights and relieved to find this hotel in our opinion was as good as others had said and why we booked it. the staff from start to finish were all extremely helpful spoke great english which is useful as us english are lazy with languages.maps in reception, advice given routes marked and advice on local eateries recommended. the room had a massive bed and my wife and i had plenty of room to stretch out and still not touch,very comfy and housekeeping great daily.bathroom was lovely with great powerful shower. breakfast at 12 euros was little steep but fair for prices there as everything you could want was there.from sausage scrambled eggs bacon fruit cakes bread crossaints ,yoghurt,cereal the list goes on and we thought terrific value really.fill up andgo location of hotel wasnt too far from everything easy 10 min ride to ramblas on 58 bus or 25 minute walk pleasant to see everything on foot at least once then bus it at 1.35 euros each way.taxi around 8 euros to catalayna square. had balcony but didnt use really as overlooked other living areas but room quiet even with doors open but hard to find centre hotel with good view so not a problem. small thing take face flannel only thing not supplied and thats about the biggest problem we faced so thanks condado you made us welcome and made our stay. one word of warning do not carry handbag and carry money loose or seperate from wallet i got pickpocketed for 130 euros at ramblas by immigrants so just be wary but not any atmosphere or fear factor just bad luck and a bad way to end our last night. recommend bus tour for great way to see barcelona without having to go everywhere in a rush.hop on hop off well worth buying.also look around for many places doing bargain deals for eating enjoyed our stay great hotel in general great people.also supermarket opposite really big once inside great for everything called marcendo..also great fridges full of coke water and non alcoholic beer great for going out and coming back hot and thirsty .free and always full for us also free internet access in reception

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, no problems and our stay was pleasant”
Reviews.Author: nononono123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my 6 y.o. son for a few days in May. We had a room on the 7th floor with a nice terrace. The room was facing the road, but the insulation is very good, meaning when the windows are closed, the room is quiet. AC unit is also quiet and worked w/out problems. We did not use the terrace much because we were not spending much time in the hotel anyway, and because of the noise. The noise is not specific to this particular road, Barcelona is absolutely gorgeous city, but it is extremely noisy, especially the center. Well, back to the hotel. The breakfast was included in the price and was nice, not very big, but the bread, cheeses and pastries were fresh every day. There is a food shop right across the road from the hotel, and we got a few snacks from there, so it is convenient too. Coca, one type of beer and water are in the fridges located on each floor, the only problem that we had was that our floor ran out of water one evening.But the next morning the fridge was full again. There is no WIFI connection on the upper floors, the reception gave me ethernet cable to connect my laptop. The cable is relatively short so the computer can stay connected only on the table (no lazy browsing on the bed). So if you want the connection everywhere in the room, perhaps you can bring a long cable with you. Overall we were quite happy with our stay and would stay in the hotel again. This was my 5th or 6th trip to Barcelona, and I've stayed on Rambla and some expensive hotels close to the center. I liked this hotel because it removes you from the hassle of the center and the crowds (they grow bigger and bigger with each year) while retaining most of the convenience. The hotel is not close to the metro station, but the buses around go frequently and bring you to most touristic spots quite fast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, But We Felt As Though We Were in a Cave...”
Reviews.Author: ballerina888
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel the least of the four we stayed at in Spain. We were in room 101, and both of our windows (one near the bed, the other in the bathroom) looked out on to a central, atrium-like area (but there was nothing atrium-like about it). We were only on the second floor, and we could have stepped out of our windows on to a little area with what seemed to be huge air conditioning ductwork. When I looked out our window initially, I could see a girl in a room near ours putting on makeup in her bathroom (she had her window open). It was a little awkward. Worst of all, we had absolutely no natural light coming into our room. We were at this hotel for the last three nights of our ten day stay in Spain, and we suddenly felt as though we were jet lagged again. It was so disorienting for it to be morning and still be very dark in our room. The lobby and common areas are beautifully decorated, and the staff guy who checked us in seemed nice. He gave us a good recommendation for a nearby restaurant when we asked for one, and we did have a very nice meal there (the Cros Diagonal). We opted not to do the buffet breakfast at the hotel---it was quite expensive, and we were perfectly content to walk a few blocks to a cafe to have some tea and a pastry or baguette. We had planned on returning our rental car after checking into the Hotel Condado, but the car place was closed on Sundays, so we had to park overnight and return the car the next morning. We arrived at the hotel around 8:00 pm or so. When my husband went out at 9:00 am the next morning to return the car, he had to pay a whopping 25 euros for the parking. It was shocking. The parking was just city parking, as the hotel does not have any, and that was with (we believe) the special rate for staying in the hotel. It was around the corner from the hotel, so my husband unloaded our bags, which I stayed with in the lobby while he went to go park. We thought the location of the hotel was quite good. Barcelona seems to be fairly spread out, so we didn't think there was necessarily a better area to stay in. We ended up walking a lot, taking a couple of cabs (which weren't too expensive), and riding the Barcelona Bus Turistic. Never managed to use the subway or city buses. The hotel is in a great location if you want to use the Barcelona Bus Turistic...we simply walked to the Placa de Francesc Macia, and were able to get on both the red and blue lines there. It seemed to be a good, not too in demand, place to get on. Other stops had long lines, and many people weren't able to sit on the top of these double decker buses because the top was already full. As for our room, another drawback was that the two pillows on the bed were very thin and insubstantial. I would have liked another one just to put under my head. Being 6 months pregnant, it would have been nice to have at least another one or two more, as well. The room was very clean, but the bathroom floor looked dirty when we first arrived. It wasn't very bad, but I would say that I'm not terribly paranoid about dirty hotel rooms and yet I noticed it and was a little bothered by it. I did like that the bathroom sink area is separate from the shower and toilet area. That can help save a little time getting ready in the morning. We didn't like the key we were given for our room. That seems a funny thing to say, but it was this huge bulky thing with an enormous tassel as a keychain. A small card key is a lot less troublesome to carry around, especially when you're planning to walk around all day and want to carry as little as possible. I was a little bothered by all the things I'd read about the clever pickpockets in Barcelona, so I carried a little canvas bag diagonally across my torso. Even after taking a number of precautions, I still worried that if a pickpocket got my bag, he'd have no trouble going to our hotel room and cleaning us out of our things there. "Hotel Condado" and "Room 101" were very clearly marked on our key. That seemed rather stupid to me. One last thing: we asked for wake-up calls all three mornings, and while we did get them, some combination of the cave-like feeling of our room and the low volume on our phone caused us to oversleep all three mornings. I slept next to the phone, picked it up, hung up, and fell back asleep every day. My husband never heard the phone at all, apparently. Yes, we were tired from packing our days very full, but we don't normally have problems oversleeping. This wasn't too big a deal until our last morning there, when we slept through our wake up call, and my husband just happened to wake up fifteen minutes before we were supposed to leave for the airport. Fortunately, we were all packed and just needed showers, but it was a far from ideal way to get ready for our imminent nine hour flight home. If I could be sure I wouldn't get a room with no view, I might consider staying at this hotel again. Honestly, though, when I think back about our few days in Barcelona now, that dark room was a really depressing place to be in such a sunny and busy city.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaGina
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Hotel Condado, prior to joining a cruise that departed from Barcelona. We're frequent travelers to Europe and we look for clean hotels in a good location at a decent price. This hotel delivered on all of those expectations. The hotel is modern in its decor, with a nice reception area that includes free internet access. The breakfast area is spacious and the breakfast itself was probably the best we've had at hotels of this size/price point. Breakfast was included in our room rate and we had a wonderful selection of cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt - even eggs and sausage. Add hot coffee that was delivered to your table by the very nice servers and you've got the perfect start to your day. Eat up because Barcelona is a big city and you'll quickly walk off any calories you eat at breakfast! The rooms in the hotel are simply, but nicely furnished. They are good size for Europe and were comfortable and clean. The air conditioning worked well and the bathroom was large with plenty of hot water for your shower. One of the best perks of this hotel - as simple as it sounds - is the free water/soda that can be found in the mini-bar on each floor. It was such a treat to grab a water on the way out or enjoy a nice Coke and a brief rest before heading out for more touring. We would describe the location as "good" but depending on your preferences you may think this hotel is a bit far from the main tourist areas of Las Ramblas. Essentially, the hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from the Diagonal metro stop at the top of Passeig de Gracia. If you walked from the hotel to Plaza Catalunya or Sagrada Familia (we did both) it's probably 30 minutes. We love to walk everywhere, so this hotel was centrally located for much of what we did. We also took the metro to Parc Guell and Montjuic, and we found Barcelona's metro system very convenient and easy to use. There were plenty of restaurants and cafe's near the hotel and there is a supermarket across the street from the hotel which was nice. Finally, we really enjoyed the service given by the hotel staff. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful, they spoke fluent English (which was a plus given our limited Spanish) and help us with transportation to the port upon our departure. The staff serving coffee in the breakfast room also were very friendly. Overall, I'd say this hotel lived up to all of the Trip Advisor reviews and certainly lived up to all of our expectations. We would stay here again if we return to Barcelona and would recommend Hotel Condado to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for business”
Reviews.Author: HeskimoUK
Reviews.Content: A good experience in general, as the hotel is well located for all of Barcelona. From a tourist viewpoint, it is a little too far from a metro, and all the main Barcelona sights, but from a business point of view, it's perfect. Good local bars and restaurants, cinema with English films a two-minute walk away, Barcelona Sants a short taxi-ride, and a comfortable and uncomplicated room. Free water and Coke is a nice touch. The only negative is that the ironing service is only avaialble in the morning, and they do not have an iron or board at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel except a staff!”
Reviews.Author: cattleHongKong
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in a family room for 4 nights from 16 April 2009. Everything is good there except one of the front staff (Ramon) and noise from nearby bars at night. When we, as non-spanish native speaker tourists coming from 6000 miles away, first arrived and all would expect questions on transport, tourist spots location etc. Ramon was very impatient to answering our questions. In addition, there is no kettle available in the room and we had asked if we may get some hot water. He even showed a bad attitude by gossiping with his colleague, betting on we were not able to understand what he said. As a good hotel with business mainly from international tourists, the hotel management should face this problem. With this stain, I would not recommend visiting unless improvement can be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for anything better at Condado!”
Reviews.Author: SuckerforSun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed April 12-15. We are both 27, we found the hotel to be clean, centrally located (aout 20 min walk to La Rambla), and the staff very friendly, all speaking good english. One of the guys there reccomended a resteraunt "Cros Diagonal" down the street acreoss the Av. Diagonal for good local cuisine...it was excellent, and really good value. The free mini bar was very nice to have, and we did not run into that again in 12 other hotels in Spain/France. Free highspeen internet in the lobby was also very handy. Overall, Condado was awesome, I highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Well done Condado”
Reviews.Author: Nick-Maria-Manolis
Reviews.Content: We 've been in Barcelona for holidays (17-21 April 2009) Perfect city, perfect hotel Condado. Clean rooms, nice location (not far from the turistic center - using the metro L-3 or the bus 58 just behind the hotel). The breakfast was more than enough (included in the on line price) and the stuff very friendly. Satelite TV, free non-alcohol minibar in every floor and many other little things wich makes the hotel better than many of 4**** or 5***** stars hotels. Very guiet room (603) dispite the crowdy street in front of the hotel (double windows do their job keeping the noise outside the rooms). EXCELLENT CONDADO

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 28 & 29th March. What can I say absolutely great hotel, not too far from the main tourist attractions. Staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was good and the room was large and comfortable. Only downside was paying £50 for two days parking as there was nowhere to park except multistorey across the road from the hotel - and the very bad weather - but hey - no-one can control that! All in all, hotel excellent base for seeing all the major sites of Barcelona. We walked to most of them - Sagrada Familia, the Port, Las Ramblas etc. etc. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: 2 worldtrade
Reviews.Content: .We visited Madrid,Seville,Granada and Barcelona.Loved all the diversity and ambiance Spain had to offer.Our last and best hotel was hotel Condado.We booked our hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed.We arrived to the hotel by taking the airport bus to placa Catalynia and then the 58 bus which stops in front of the hotel.The hotel is about 15 minutes from the tourist attractions.Which was a plus for us because we wanted a quiet place to sleep away from the tourist noise.Upon our arrival our room was not ready.(we arrived about 12 noon).The front desk personell were very professional and courteous,and spoke english very well and offered to store our luggage till our room was ready.Our room was ready within the hour, and we were happily surprised to see a large, by european standards room which was very clean and comfortable.Hotel also offers free internet,water and soda.If you book on their website you may get specials that include free breakfast.Breakfast was of high quality.I would recommend this hotel and would gladly stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Boutique Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: emaches
Reviews.Content: Triple Room on first floor has a good sized patio instead of a terrace. Quiet room.Nice walk to subway; bus from Barceloneta goes thru downtown and stops right across the street from the hotel - very convienient. Complimentary sodas and water on ech floor were a very nice touch. Non touristy location but many shops and very easy to find pubs and restaurants with good prices. Good continential Breakfast buffet a good day starter. Front desk staff very courteous, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariaelk
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Metro is some distance away from hotel but the bus service to points of interest from hotel is excellent. The bathroom for triple room is big and best feauture is it has 2 sinks. Ample storage capacity. Free mini bar (for soft drinks and water) is very useful especially at night or in the mornings. Ask front desk to show on the map where to take bus 58 to Placa Catalunya. Ask tourist information there for "See Barcelona" booklet which describes points of interest, buses, restaurants by region. Must also ask tourist info for museum time and price schedule. Ask hotel front desk/tourist info where to catch bus to points of interest from hotel/placa Catalunya. Buy T10 from metro station (10 trips on metro or bus and different people can use same ticket). Do not use Bus Turistica especially in winter as upperdeck is in the open and lower deck is cold. The time schedule esp on Sundays is not good. It is expensive and not good value for money. Take bus 24(from Catalunya Placa) or 92 (from hotel) to Park Guell as metro station is far from Park Guell and streets are steeply inclined. The streets around the hotel have great shops and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanchetta
Reviews.Content: Condado is really great hotel. Polite and smiling stuff, clean rooms, beverage for free :), cosy interior, in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, cosy and not very expensive. 100% recommended.”
Reviews.Author: fmrr
Reviews.Content: Has everything you may need at a resonable low price. Is not "just in center" but bus transportation is fast and very frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Soul42
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed on Hotel Candado for 3 nights. Hotel Condado is a very nice and little hotel in the district of Digonal. I think the hotel location was wonderful, I little bit away from the city center. But not to long! We stayed at the Family room, which actually is two separate room with two bath. We loved this room, it was perfect for us. The breakfast was very tasteable. The staff is also very gentle and kind. I will recommand this hotel to everybody, who are going to Barcelona. I cant belive that this hotel is ranked with only 3 stars, it deserve atleast 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly people!”
Reviews.Author: veramorales
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Condado for a short visit to Barcelona from January 18 - 21, 2009. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would like to give extra credit to the front desk staff and the servers at breakfast namely Ramil and the other lady. They were very courteous and delightfully nice. Being in the travel industry I would definitely recommend this hotel to my colleagues, friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Condado!!!”
Reviews.Author: SSLWorld
Reviews.Content: Simple but excellent hotel. The simple things always ar successful. Room very well equipped, better than many first class hotels. The decor absolutely cool. Free Internet service and soft drinks. Excellent! Located in a very elegant city center neighbouhood full of restaurants and bars with local people. very polite and helpful staff providing information about the city and restaurants. Wide range of products in the breakfast service and not really expensive if you are a brekfast person. Very close to public transport. We come back very satisfied with Condado. Well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mark075Glasgow
Reviews.Content: perfect choice!!! we booked the Condado on its website after reading TA reviews. Condado is an excellent value in a very central location. Not so far from Ramblas as expected (about 20 minutes walking). however, Barcelona is a big city and distances are not son long as Madrid. The Condado is perfect. modern facilities, extra mile service even being tourist class hotel. After lomng days discovering the city, was very pleasant get free soft drinks and free internet connection to check e-mails and upload pictures. staff speak fluent English, even some housekeeping supervisors and are very friendly and useful. We had breakfast included in our plan. Wide range of products and Super expresso!!! I loved the french croissants. No doubts, the Condado was a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Condado”
Reviews.Author: traveller7373
Reviews.Content: Definetively, super experience in Barcelona. We spent five nights at Condado. Excellent value. We got a lovely superior room larger than a first class hotel in many places. Free Internet and soft drinks Well done Condado!!! Staff are veyr polite, friendly and useful giving directions and nearby restaurant suggestions. Get breakfast. if you book online on own website choose "breakfast included promo" costst about 8 euros per person. On spot, 12 euros. Very well assorted, frsh products, terrific "jamon iberico" , fruit, scrambled eggs, sausages,..... Forget cabs. Barcelona gets a comprehensive public transport network. Condado is in an upmarket neighbourhood very central. Lovely walking to Catalunya sq and Ramblas. Passeig de GRacia is very close with amazing modern style buildings and some of the most expensives botuqiues in town. we went some tapas restaurants in the area. Much better and cheaper than Ramblas. Condado, we'll come back soon. We love Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: smlworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is near a bus stop that can take you down to Barceloneta and a metro stop is two blocks away. The Passeig de Gracia (Barcelona's version of Champs Elysee) is a nice 10 minute walk away, from there you can walk down to the Plaza Catalunya which is where Las Ramblas begins. Gaudi's La Pedrera and "House of bones" is on Psseig de Gracia. Also from Plaza Catalunya you can catch the Bus Turistic. Service was good. I had breakfast at the hotel and it was fine. There was fruit, various breads, cheese, cold meats and even a hot plate (bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs). The gentlemen at the front desk are very helpful and kind from giving directions to making reservations. Ramon speaks very good English and was very helpful during my stay. The rooms are neat and clean. Also they have internet service, wi-fi if you stay on the first floor. If I come back to Barcelona I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Condado - a mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: justpassinby
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in Sept. 2008. I remembered that the hotel had specifically contacted us to fill out a review on tripadvisor. Here goes... As for our experience at the Hotel Condado, we had a mixed experience. The downstairs hotel staff was very helpful. The rooms were nice. The free drinks (soda and water) were a nice surprise as well. We did have two big disappointments after staying at the hotel for 5 nights. First, we had asked for a single room, and our confirmation indicated we had gotten a family room for 4 people. In my notes to the hotel, I had specified that we wanted a single room, but we received two rooms that were joined by a small space with the outer door. This situation of two rooms was not made clear to us, because we thought all 4 of us would be sharing a room. They actually do not have a single room for 4 people (according to what the front desk told us). Instead, they have 2 separate rooms that is separated by a small shared area that can be locked from the outside. The interesting thing is that they charge you for 2 rooms, although you may ask for just one. This situation was either unintentional or deceptive, but either way, it was not what we expected. The second problem we had was with the cleaning service. We posted do not disturb on the door at least 3 different days we were there. Every single time without fail, they would come into the room even when the posted "Do not Disturb" sign was on the door knob. We were sick on our 4th day, and I had to worry about them coming in while I was sick (Sure enough, they attempted to come in). This was completely unacceptable. Why have those signs for guests to hang from their doorknob if they are completely disregarded? As far as location, the hotel was a bit further north from Las Ramblas that we would have liked. My suggestion is to look elsewhere if you have other options and stay here if you can't find anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Barcelona, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAFITAILLE
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much my stay at hotel condado: great room, nice staff, nice area (do not hesitate to take a cab to anywhere in Barcelona, very cheap!). Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Boonsie
Reviews.Content: We had two twin rooms with it's own lobby - ideal when traveling with a family. We couldn't fault the hotel itself although you could feel a bit isolated, however, the bars and restaurants in this area of the city are better quality and more authentic than the ones closer to the Rambla. Get on the Turistic bus before doing anything else- red and blue stops about 5 mins walk away to put the location of the hotel into perspective - its pretty central. (Both loops will take about 3 hrs - nice way to sit and do nothing) I wouldn't bother with the metro if staying here, use the buses instead (10 trip ticket 7 Euro) - No.64 goes to the beach (about 30 mins), No.58 goes to Place de Cataluna (about 10 mins) (both leave on the street behind the hotel and drop off right outside hotel and run every 10-15 mins) Alternatively taxi from Port Olympic to the hotel cost about 10 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: girl5
Reviews.Content: Great, spacious rooms that are well maintained and very comfortable. Although it is not walking distance from Las Ramblas, cabs in Barcelona are reasonable (approx 8-10 euros). Loved the fact that internet, bottled water, coke and a local beer was complimentary. The biggest drawback was the obnoxious concierge. Would definitely recommend the hotel to young travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Hotel Runs Like A Swiss Watch”
Reviews.Author: senorbigstuff
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely exceeded our expectations. Courteous uniformed staff was very professional and very helpful. When we reported ethernet problems, we were moved to a different --and better -- room in the rear of the property. This solved the Internet problem and also got us on the good side of the building. Rooms on the front face a group of night clubs. Despite double-insulated windows, it was still pretty noisy up there. Another delightful surprise...we arrived at 9:00 a.m. Sunday after a trip from the US and were permitted to immediately check into our room. That shower felt pretty good!
